ï»¿Through the Postern Gate

A ROMANCE IN SEVEN DAYS

By

[Florence L. Barclay]46-florence l. barclay

Author of " The Rosary , "[46-florence l. barclay] " [The Mistress of [Shenstone]1-shenstone]1243-the mistress of shenstone , "[47-putnam] " [The Following of the Star]1244-the following of the star , "[48-christobel] etc

[London]2-london and [New York]3-new york G. P. [Putnam]47-putnam 's Sons 1912

146th Thousand

Made and Printed in [Great Britain]4-great britain by [The Camelot Press Limited]5-the camelot press limited , [Southampton]6-southampton .

TO [[MY]0-my MOTHER]127-my mother

[THE]9-the FIRST DAY

THE STORY OF [LITTLE BOY BLUE]52-little boy blue

" But it was not [[your]1245-your niece]1246-your niece ! It was always [you]1245-your [I]129-the boy wanted , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy .

[He]129-the boy lay back , in a deep wicker chair , under the old mulberry - tree . [He]129-the boy had taken the precaution of depositing [his]129-the boy cup and saucer on the soft turf beneath [his]129-the boy chair , because [he]129-the boy knew that , under the stress of sudden emotion , china especially the best china had a way of flying off [his]129-the boy knee . And there was no question as to the exquisite quality of the china on the dainty tea - table over which [Miss Christobel Charteris]48-christobel presided .

[The Boy]129-the boy had watched [her]48-christobel pouring the tea into those pretty rose - leaf cups , nearly every afternoon during the golden two weeks just over . [He]129-the boy knew every movement of those firm white hands , so soft , yet so strong and capable .

[The Boy]52-little boy blue used to stand beside [her]48-christobel , ready to hand [Mollie]53-mollie 's cup , as punctiliously as if [a dozen girls]131-a dozen girls had been sitting in [the old garden]132-the old garden , waiting to be quickly served by [the only man]133-the only man .

[The Boy]129-the boy enjoyed being [the only man]133-the only man . Also [he]129-the boy had quite charming manners . [He]129-the boy never allowed the passing of bread - and - butter to interfere with the flow of conversation ; yet the bread - and - butter was always within reach at the precise moment [you]136-you wanted it , though [the Boy]129-the boy 's bright eyes were fixed just then in keenest interest on [the person who happened to be speaking , and not a point of the story , or a word of the remark]138-the person who happened to be speaking , and not a point of the story , or a word of the remark , was missed either by [him]129-the boy or by [you]136-you .

[He]129-the boy used to watch [the Aunt]139-the aunt 's beautiful hands very closely ; and at last , every time [he]129-the boy looked at them , [his]129-the boy brown eyes kissed them . [The Boy]129-the boy thought this was a delightful secret known only to [himself]129-the boy . But one day , when [he]129-the boy was bending over [her]139-the aunt , holding [his]129-the boy own cup while [she]139-the aunt filled it , [the Aunt]141-the aunt suddenly said : " Do n't ! "[141-the aunt] It was so startling and unexpected , that the cup almost flew out of [his]129-the boy hand . [The Boy]129-the boy might have said : " Do n't what ? "[129-the boy] which would have put [the Aunt]141-the aunt in a difficulty , because it would have been so very impossible to explain . But [he]129-the boy was too honest . [He]129-the boy at once did n't , and felt a little shy for five minutes ; then recovered , and hugged [himself]129-the boy with a fearful joy at the thought that [she]139-the aunt had known [his]129-the boy eyes had kissed [her]139-the aunt dear beautiful hands ; then stole a look at [her]139-the aunt calm face , so completely unmoved in its classic beauty , and thought [he]129-the boy must have been mistaken ; only what on earth else could [she]139-the aunt have said " Do n't ! "[139-the aunt] about , at that moment ?

But [Mollie]53-mollie was there , then ; so no explanations were possible . Now at last , thank goodness , [Mollie]53-mollie had gone , and [his]129-the boy own seven days had begun . This was the first day ; and [he]129-the boy was going to tell [her]139-the aunt everything . There was absolutely nothing [he]129-the boy would not be able to tell [her]139-the aunt . The delight of this fairly swept [the Boy]129-the boy off [his]129-the boy feet . [He]129-the boy had kept on [the curb]145-the curb so long ; and [he]129-the boy was not used to curbs of any kind .

[He]129-the boy lay back , [his]129-the boy hands behind [his]129-the boy head , and watched [the Aunt]141-the aunt 's kind face , through half - closed lids . [His]129-the boy brown eyes were shining , but very soft . When [the Aunt]141-the aunt looked at [them]148-them , [she]141-the aunt quickly looked away .

" How could [you]141-the aunt think the attraction would be gone ? "[129-the boy] [he]129-the boy said . " It was always [you]141-the aunt , [I]129-the boy wanted , not [[your]141-the aunt niece]1246-your niece . Good heavens ! How can [you]141-the aunt have thought it was [Mollie]53-mollie , when it was [you]141-the aunt [YOU]141-the aunt , just only [you]141-the aunt , all the time ? "[129-the boy]

[The Aunt]141-the aunt raised [her]141-the aunt beautiful eyebrows and looked [him]129-the boy straight in the face .

" Is this a proposal ? "[141-the aunt] [she]141-the aunt asked , quietly .

" Of course it is , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy ; " and jolly hard it has been , having to wait two whole weeks to make it . [I]129-the boy want [you]141-the aunt to marry [me]129-the boy , [Christobel]48-christobel . [I]129-the boy dare say [you]141-the aunt think [me]129-the boy [a cheeky young beggar to suggest it , point blank]1248-a cheeky young beggar to suggest it , point blank . But [I]129-the boy want [you]141-the aunt to give [me]129-the boy seven days ; and , in those seven days , [I]129-the boy am going to win [you]141-the aunt . Then it will seem to [you]141-the aunt , as it does to [me]129-the boy , the only possible thing to do . "[129-the boy]

[His]129-the boy brown eyes were wide open now ; and the glory of the love shining out from them dazzled [her]141-the aunt . [She]141-the aunt looked away .

Then the swift colour swept over the face which all [Cambridge]16-cambridge considered classic in its stern strong beauty , and [she]141-the aunt laughed ; but rather breathlessly .

" [[You]129-the boy amazing boy]1249-you amazing boy ! "[141-the aunt] [she]141-the aunt said . " Do [you]1249-you amazing boy consider it right to take away [a person]1250-a person 's breath , in this fashion ? Or are [you]1249-you amazing boy trying to be funny ? "[141-the aunt]

" [I]129-the boy have no designs on [your]141-the aunt breath , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy ; " and it is [my]129-the boy misfortune , but not [my]129-the boy fault , if [I]129-the boy seem funny . "[129-the boy] Then [he]129-the boy sat forward in [his]129-the boy chair , [his]129-the boy elbows on [his]129-the boy knees , and both brown hands held out towards [her]141-the aunt . " [I]129-the boy want [you]141-the aunt to understand , [dear]1251-dear , "[129-the boy] [he]129-the boy continued , earnestly , " that [I]129-the boy have said only a very little of all [I]129-the boy have to say . But [I]129-the boy hope that little is to the point ; and [I]129-the boy jolly well mean it . "[129-the boy]

[The Aunt]141-the aunt laughed again , and swung the toe of [her]141-the aunt neat brown shoe ; a habit [she]141-the aunt had , when trying to appear more at ease than [she]141-the aunt felt .

" It is certainly to the point , "[141-the aunt] [she]141-the aunt said . " There can be no possible doubt about that . But are [you]129-the boy aware , [dear boy]1252-dear boy , that [I]141-the aunt have been assiduously chaperoning [you]129-the boy and [[my]141-the aunt niece]1253-my niece , during the past two weeks ; and watching , with the affectionate interest of [a middle - aged relative]1254-a middle - aged relative , the course of true love running with satisfactory and unusual smoothness ? "[141-the aunt]

[The Boy]129-the boy ignored the adjectives and innuendoes , and went straight to the point . [He]129-the boy always had a way of ignoring all side issues or carefully introduced irrelevancy . It made [him]129-the boy [a difficult person to deal with]154-a difficult person to deal with , if the principal weapon in [your]155-your armoury was elaborate argument .

" Why did [you]141-the aunt say ' Do n't ' ? "[129-the boy] asked [the Boy]129-the boy .

[The Aunt]141-the aunt fell at once into the unintentional trap . [She]141-the aunt dropped [her]141-the aunt calmly amused manner and answered hurriedly , while again the swift colour flooded [her]141-the aunt face : " [Boy]52-little boy blue dear , [I]141-the aunt hardly know . It was something [you]52-little boy blue did , which , for a moment , [I]141-the aunt could not quite bear . Something passed from [you]52-little boy blue to [me]141-the aunt , too intimate , too sweet , to be quite right . [I]141-the aunt said ' Do n't , ' as involuntarily as one would say ' Do n't ' to a threatened blow . "[141-the aunt]

" It was n't a blow , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy , tenderly . " It was a kiss . Every time [I]129-the boy looked at [your]141-the aunt dear beautiful hand , lifting the silver teapot , [I]129-the boy kissed it . Did n't [you]141-the aunt feel it was a kiss ? "[129-the boy]

" No ; [I]141-the aunt only felt it was unusual ; something [I]141-the aunt could not understand ; and [I]141-the aunt did not like it . Therefore [I]141-the aunt said ' Do n't . ' "[141-the aunt]

" But [you]141-the aunt admit it was sweet ? "[129-the boy] persisted [the Boy]129-the boy .

" Exactly , "[141-the aunt] replied [the Aunt]141-the aunt ; " quite incomprehensibly sweet . And [I]141-the aunt do not like things [I]141-the aunt can not comprehend ; especially with [amazing boys]1255-amazing boys about ! "[141-the aunt]

" Did n't [you]141-the aunt know it was love ? "[129-the boy] asked [the Boy]129-the boy , softly .

" No , "[141-the aunt] replied [the Aunt]141-the aunt , emphatically ; " most certainly , [I]141-the aunt did not . "[141-the aunt]

[The Boy]129-the boy got up , and came and knelt beside the arm of [her]141-the aunt chair .

" It was love , "[129-the boy] [he]129-the boy said , [his]129-the boy lips very close to the soft waves of [her]141-the aunt hair .

" Go back to [your]129-the boy seat at once , "[141-the aunt] said [the Aunt]141-the aunt , sternly .

[The Boy]129-the boy went .

" And where does [poor Mollie]53-mollie come in , in all this ? "[141-the aunt] inquired [the Aunt]141-the aunt , with some asperity .

" [Mollie]53-mollie ? "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy , complacently . " Oh , [Mollie]53-mollie understood all right . [She]53-mollie loves [Phil]55-phil , [you]129-the boy know ; intends to stick to [him]55-phil , and knows [you]129-the boy will back [her]53-mollie . The last part of the time , [I]129-the boy brought [her]53-mollie notes from [Phil]55-phil , every day . Do n't be angry , [dear]1251-dear . [You]129-the boy would have done it [yourself]129-the boy , if [Mollie]53-mollie and [Phil]55-phil had got hold of [you]129-the boy , and implored [you]129-the boy to be [a go - between]1257-a go - between . [You]129-the boy remember the day [we]1258-we invaded [the kitchen]1259-the kitchen to see how [Martha]56-martha made those little puffy buns [you]129-the boy know the explosives ? [You]129-the boy pinch them in the middle , and they burst into hundreds and thousands of little pieces . Jolly things for [a stiff stand - up - in - [a - crowd]1261-a - crowd - and - all - hold - [your]129-the boy - own - cups kind of drawing - room party]1260-a stiff stand - up - in - a - crowd - and - all - hold - your - own - cups kind of drawing - room party ; what [we]1258-we used to call ' [a Perpendicular]1262-a perpendicular ' in [my]129-the boy Cambridge days . [I]129-the boy suppose [they]1263-they still keep up the name . Fancy those little buns exploding all over [the place]1264-the place ; and when [you]129-the boy try to pick up the fragments , they go into simply millions of crumbs , between [your]129-the boy agitated fingers and anxious thumb ! "[129-the boy]

[The Boy]129-the boy slapped [his]129-the boy knee in intense enjoyment , and momentarily lost the thread of the conversation . [The Aunt]141-the aunt 's mind was not sufficiently detached to feel equal to a digression into peals of laughter over this vision of the explosive buns . [She]141-the aunt wanted to find out how much [Mollie]53-mollie knew . When [the Boy]129-the boy had finished rocking backwards and forwards in [his]129-the boy chair , [she]141-the aunt suggested , tentatively : " [You]129-the boy went to [the kitchen]1259-the kitchen ? "[141-the aunt]

" Oh , yes , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy , recovering . " [We]1258-we went to [the kitchen]1259-the kitchen to watch [Martha]56-martha make them , and to get the recipe . [You]129-the boy see [Mollie]53-mollie wanted them for [[her]53-mollie father]1267-her father 's clerical ' at [homes]1268-homes . ' Oh , [I]129-the boy say fancy ! [The archdeacons]1269-the archdeacons and [curates]1270-curates , [the rectors]1271-the rectors and [vicars]1272-vicars , all standing in a solemn crowd on [the Bishop]1273-the bishop 's best velvet - pile carpet ; then [Mollie]53-mollie , so demure , handing round the innocent - looking little buns ; and , hey presto ! the pinching begins , and the explosions , and the hopeless attempts to gather up the fragments ! "[129-the boy]

[The Boy]129-the boy nearly went off again ; but [he]129-the boy suddenly realized that [the Aunt]141-the aunt was not amused , and pulled [himself]129-the boy together .

" Well , [we]1258-we stopped on the way to [the kitchen]1259-the kitchen for mutual confidences . It was not easy , bounded as [we]1258-we were by [you]129-the boy on the one side , and [Martha]56-martha on the other . [We]1258-we had to whisper . [I]141-the aunt dare say [you]129-the boy thought [we]1258-we were kissing behind the door , but [we]1258-we jolly well were n't ! [She]141-the aunt told [me]141-the aunt about [Phil]55-phil ; and [I]141-the aunt told [her]141-the aunt oh , [I]141-the aunt told [her]141-the aunt something of what [I]141-the aunt am trying to tell [you]129-the boy . Just enough to make [her]141-the aunt understand ; so that [we]1258-we could go ahead , and play the game fair , all round . [She]141-the aunt was awfully glad , because [she]141-the aunt said : ' [I]141-the aunt have long feared [[my]141-the aunt dear beautiful Aunt]1275-my dear beautiful aunt would marry [an ichthyosaurus]1276-an ichthyosaurus . ' [I]141-the aunt asked [her]141-the aunt what the what the [I]141-the aunt mean , what on earth the meaning of that was ? And [she]141-the aunt said : ' [An old fossil]1277-an old fossil . ' "[141-the aunt]

Again the swift flush swept over the calm face . But this time [the Aunt]141-the aunt went off , intentionally , on a side issue .

" [I]141-the aunt have heard [you]175-you say ' What the deuce ' before now , [Boy]52-little boy blue . But [I]141-the aunt am glad [you]175-you appear to realize , judging by [your]175-you laboured efforts to suppress them , that these expressions shock [me]141-the aunt . "[141-the aunt]

[She]141-the aunt looked at [him]175-you , quizzically , through half - closed lids ; but [the Boy]129-the boy was wholly earnest .

" Well , [you]141-the aunt see , "[175-you] [he]175-you said , " [I]175-you am trying most awfully hard to be , in every respect , just what [you]141-the aunt would wish [the man who loves [you]141-the aunt]1278-the man who loves you should be . "[175-you]

" Oh , [[you]52-little boy blue dear boy]1279-you dear boy , "[48-christobel] said [Christobel Charteris]48-christobel , a flood of sudden feeling softening [her]48-christobel face ; " [I]48-christobel must make [you]1279-you dear boy understand that [I]48-christobel can not possibly take [you]1279-you dear boy seriously . [I]48-christobel shall have to tell [you]1279-you dear boy a story [no one]1280-no one has ever heard before ; a tender little story of a long - ago past . [I]48-christobel must tell [you]1279-you dear boy the story of [my]48-christobel Little [Boy Blue]52-little boy blue . Wait here a few moments , while [I]48-christobel go [indoors]1281-indoors and give orders that [we]1282-we are not to be disturbed . "[48-christobel]

Rising , [she]48-christobel passed up [the lawn]177-the lawn to [the little white house]178-the little white house . [The Boy]52-little boy blue 's eyes followed [her]48-christobel , noting with pride and delight [the tall athletic figure , fully developed , gracious in its ample lines , yet graceful in the perfect swing of the well - poised walk]179-the tall athletic figure , fully developed , gracious in its ample lines , yet graceful in the perfect swing of the well - poised walk . During all [his]180-he college years [he]180-he had known that walk ; admired [that stately figure]181-that stately figure . [He]180-he had been in the set which called [her]48-christobel " [Juno]57-juno "[48-christobel] and " [The Goddess "]1283-the goddess "[48-christobel] ; which crowded to [the clubs]182-the clubs if there was a chance of watching [her]48-christobel play tennis . And now , during two wonderful weeks , [he]180-he had been admitted , [a welcomed guest]183-a welcomed guest , to [this little old - world oasis , bounded by high red - brick walls , where [she]48-christobel dwelt and ruled]184-this little old - world oasis , bounded by high red - brick walls , where she dwelt and ruled . Quiet , sunny , happy hours [he]180-he had spent in the hush of [the old garden]132-the old garden , strolling up and down the long narrow velvet turf , beneath the spreading trees , from the green postern gate in the right - hand corner of the bottom wall , to the flight of stone steps leading up to [the garden - door of [the little white house]178-the little white house]186-the garden - door of the little white house .

[The Boy]129-the boy knew , by now , exactly what [he]129-the boy wanted . [He]129-the boy wanted to marry [Christobel Charteris]48-christobel .

[He]129-the boy must have been rather [a brave boy]189-a brave boy . [He]129-the boy looked very youthful and slim as [he]129-the boy lay back in [his]129-the boy chair , watching the stately proportions of [the woman on whom [he]129-the boy had set [his]129-the boy young heart]190-the woman on whom he had set his young heart ; very slight and boyish , in [his]129-the boy silver - grey suit , with lavender tie , and buttonhole of violas . [The Boy]52-little boy blue was very particular about [his]129-the boy ties and buttonholes . They always matched . This afternoon , for the first time , [he]129-the boy had arrived without a buttonhole . In the surprise and pleasure of [his]129-the boy unexpected appearance , [the Aunt]141-the aunt had moved quickly down [the sunlit lawn]192-the sunlit lawn to meet and greet [him]129-the boy .

[Mollie]53-mollie had departed , early that morning . [Her]53-mollie final words at [the railway station]193-the railway station , as [her]53-mollie impish little face smiled farewell from the window of [[her]53-mollie compartment]194-her compartment , had been : " Mind , [Auntie dear]1284-auntie dear , no mistake about [Guy Chelsea]50-guy chelsea ! [He]50-guy chelsea 's [a charming fellow]1285-a charming fellow ; and thank [you]1284-auntie dear ever so much for giving [me]53-mollie such a good time with [him]50-guy chelsea . But [you]1284-auntie dear can report to [Papa]58-papa , that [Guy Chelsea]50-guy chelsea , and [[his]50-guy chelsea beautiful properties]1286-his beautiful properties , and [[his]50-guy chelsea prospective peerage]1287-his prospective peerage , and [his]50-guy chelsea fifty thousand a year , and [his]50-guy chelsea [motor - cars]1288-motor - cars , and [his]50-guy chelsea flying - machines , are absolutely powerless to tempt [me]53-mollie away from [my]53-mollie allegiance to [Phil]55-phil . [Beside]59-beside , it so happens , [Guy]50-guy chelsea [himself]50-guy chelsea is altogether in love with [SOME ONE ELSE]1289-some one else . "[53-mollie]

[The train]195-the train having begun to move at the words " [You]53-mollie can report to [Papa]58-papa , "[53-mollie] [Mollie]53-mollie finished the remainder of the sentence in a screaming crescendo , holding on to [her]53-mollie hat with one hand , and waving a tiny lace pocket - handkerchief , emphatically , with the other . Even then , [the Aunt]141-the aunt lost most of the sentence , and disbelieved the rest . The atmosphere of love had been so unmistakable during those two weeks ; the superabundant overflow had even reached [herself]53-mollie more than once , with an almost startling thrill of emotion .

[The Boy]129-the boy had been so full of vivid , glowing joie - de - vivre , radiating fun and gaiety around [him]129-the boy .

In [their]198-they sets of tennis , played on [[her]53-mollie own court across [the lane]200-the lane at the bottom of [the garden]201-the garden]199-her own court across the lane at the bottom of the garden , when [she]53-mollie could beat [him]129-the boy easily were [he]129-the boy handicapped by partnership with [Mollie]53-mollie ; but in genuine singles , when [Mollie]53-mollie had tactfully collapsed on to a seat and declared [herself]53-mollie exhausted , [his]129-the boy swift agility counterbalanced [her]53-mollie magnificent service , and [they]198-they were so evenly matched that each game proved a keen delight

In [the quiet teas beneath the mulberry tree]202-the quiet teas beneath the mulberry tree , where the incomprehensible atmosphere of unspoken tenderness gilded the light words and laughter , as sunlight touches leaf and flower to gold

At the cosy dinners , to which [they]198-they sometimes asked [him]129-the boy , sitting in [the garden]201-the garden afterwards in the moonlight ; when [he]129-the boy would tell [them]198-they thrilling tales of aviation , describing [his]129-the boy initial flights , hairbreadth escapes ; the joys of rapid soaring ; the dangers of cross - currents , broken propellers , or twisted steering - gear

On all these occasions , [the Boy]129-the boy with [his]129-the boy enthusiasm , [his]129-the boy fun , and [his]129-the boy fire had been the life of [the happy trio]205-the happy trio .

During those evenings , in the moonlight , when [he]129-the boy started off on [airships]206-airships , one heart stood still very often while [the Boy]129-the boy talked ; but it stood still , silently . It was [Mollie]53-mollie who clasped [her]53-mollie hands and implored [him]129-the boy never to fly again ; then , in the next breath , begged [him]129-the boy to take [her]53-mollie as [a passenger]208-a passenger , on the first possible occasion .

Happy days ! But [Mollie]53-mollie was the attraction ; therefore , with [Mollie]53-mollie 's departure , they would naturally come to an end .

[The Boy]129-the boy had not asked if [he]129-the boy might come again ; and , for the moment , [she]53-mollie forgot that [the Boy]129-the boy rarely asked for what [he]129-the boy wanted . [He]129-the boy usually took it .

[She]53-mollie had a lonely luncheon ; spent the afternoon over letters and accounts , picking up the dull threads of things laid aside during the gay holiday time .

It was not [the Professor]211-the professor 's day for calling . [She]53-mollie was alone until four . Then [she]53-mollie went out and sat under the mulberry . [The garden]201-the garden was very quiet . The birds ' hour of silence was barely over .

[Jenkins]60-jenkins , [the butler]213-the butler , had been sent into [the town]214-the town , so [Martha]56-martha brought out tea ; as ample , as carefully arranged , as ever ; and cups for two !

" Why two cups , [Martha]56-martha ? "[48-christobel] queried [Miss Charteris]48-christobel , languidly .

[The Aunt]141-the aunt walked quickly to meet [him]129-the boy . [His]129-the boy arrival was so unexpected ; and [she]141-the aunt had been so lonely , and so dull .

" [You]129-the boy quite [absurd boy]1375-absurd boy ! "[141-the aunt] said [the Aunt]141-the aunt , laughing . [The Boy]129-the boy sat forward , eagerly .

" [I]129-the boy have always loved the story of how [the army of [Israel]11-israel]1376-the army of israel marched round [Jericho]12-jericho during seven days . It appeals to [me]129-the boy . [The well - garrisoned , invincible city]1377-the well - garrisoned , invincible city , with [its]1377-the well - garrisoned , invincible city high walls and barred gates . [The silent , determined army]1378-the silent , determined army , marching round [it]1377-the well - garrisoned , invincible city , once every day . Apparently nothing was happening ; but , in reality , [their]1378-the silent , determined army faith , enthusiasm , and will - power were undermining those mighty walls . And on the seventh day , when [they]1378-the silent , determined army marched round seven times to the blast of the priestly trumpets ; at the seventh time , the ordeal of silence was over ; leave was given to [the great silent host]1379-the great silent host to shout . So the rams ' horns sounded a louder blast than ever ; and then , with all the pent - up enthusiasm born of those seven days of silent marching , [the people]1380-the people shouted ! Down fell [the walls of [Jericho]12-jericho]1381-the walls of jericho , and up [the conquerors]1382-the conquerors went , right into [the heart of [the citadel]1384-the citadel]1383-the heart of the citadel .... [Neither]253-neither spoke a word , for some minutes . [The Boy]129-the boy lay back , watching the mysterious moving of the mulberry leaves . [The Aunt]141-the aunt watched [the Boy]129-the boy , and wondered whether [she]141-the aunt must tell [him]129-the boy about [the Professor]211-the professor , before the seventh day ; and what [he]129-the boy would say , when [she]141-the aunt did tell [him]129-the boy ; and how [Jericho]12-jericho would feel when [the army of [Israel]11-israel]1376-the army of israel , with silent trumpets and banners drooping , marched disconsolate away , leaving [its]1376-the army of israel walls still standing ; [its]1376-the army of israel gates still barred . [The Boy]129-the boy stopped suddenly , struck dumb by the look on the beautiful face beneath [his]129-the boy . [He]129-the boy saw it pale to absolute whiteness , while the dear firm lips faltered and trembled . [He]129-the boy saw the startled pain leap into the eyes . [He]129-the boy did not understand the cause of [her]291-she emotion , or know that [he]129-the boy had wakened in that strongly repressed nature the desperate hunger for motherhood , possible only to [woman]292-woman at the finest and best .

[She]291-she realized now why [she]291-she had never forgotten [her]291-she Little Boy Blue of [the Dovercourt sands]293-the dovercourt sands . [Her]291-she heart seemed to turn to marble and cease beating . [She]291-she felt helpless in [her]291-she pain . [She]291-she looked helplessly up into [his]129-the boy longing , glowing , boyish face so sweet , so young , so beautiful .

Should [she]291-she put up [her]291-she arms and draw it to [her]291-she breast ?

[She]291-she had given no actual promise to [the Professor]211-the professor . [She]291-she had not mentioned [him]129-the boy to [the Boy]129-the boy .

Ah , [dear God]303-dear god ! If one had waited twelve long years for a thing which was to prove but an empty husk after all ! In order not to fail the possible expectations of another , had [she]291-she any right to lay such a heavy burden of disappointment upon [[her]291-she little Boy Blue]304-her little boy blue ? And , if [she]291-she must do so , how could [she]291-she best help [him]129-the boy to bear it ?

" [Fanks]61-fanks , "[291-she] came a brave little voice , with almost startling distinctness , across the shore of memory ; " [Fanks]61-fanks , but [I]291-she always does [my]291-she own cawwying . "[291-she]

" [[Boy]68-her little boy blue , or of baby boy blues so like him dear]1296-boy dear , "[291-she] [she]291-she said , gently ; " please go now . [I]291-she am tired . "[291-she]

Then [she]291-she shut [her]291-she eyes .

In a few seconds [she]291-she heard the gate close , and knew [the garden]201-the garden was empty .

Tears slipped from between the closed lids , and coursed slowly down [her]291-she cheeks . The only right way is apt to be a way of such pain at the moment , that [even those souls possessing clearest vision and endowed with strongest faith]306-even those souls possessing clearest vision and endowed with strongest faith , are unable to hear the golden clarion - call , sounding amid the din of present conflict : " Through much tribulation , enter into [the kingdom]1389-the kingdom . "[308-the elderly housekeeper]

Thus hopeless tears fell in [the old garden]132-the old garden .

And [Martha]56-martha , [the elderly housekeeper]308-the elderly housekeeper , faithful but curious , let fall the lath of the green Venetian blind covering the storeroom window , through which [she]56-martha had permitted [herself]56-martha to peep . As the postern gate closed on the erect figure of [the Boy]129-the boy , [she]56-martha dropped the blind and turned away , an unwonted tear running down the furrows of [her]56-martha hard old face .

" [Lord]1444-lord love ' [i]56-martha m ! "[56-martha] [she]56-martha said . " [He]129-the boy 'll get what [he]129-the boy wants in time . There 's [not a woman]1445-not a woman walks [this earth]1446-this earth as could n't never refuse ' [i]56-martha m nothing . "[56-martha]

With which startling array of negatives , [old Martha]56-martha compiled one supreme positive in favour of [the Boy]129-the boy , leaving altogether out of account alas ! [the Professor]211-the professor .

Then [she]56-martha wiped [her]56-martha eyes with [her]56-martha apron , and chid [her]56-martha nose harshly for an unexpected display of sentiment .

And [the Boy]129-the boy tramped back to [[his]129-the boy hotel]313-his hotel with [his]129-the boy soul full of glory , knowing [his]129-the boy first march round had been to some purpose . The walls of [the beloved Citadel]314-the beloved citadel had trembled indeed .

" And the evening and the morning were the first day . "[129-the boy]

THE SECOND DAY

[MISS CHARTERIS TAKES CONTROL

The Boy]69-miss charteris arrived in flannels , [his]129-the boy racket under [his]129-the boy arm . [He]129-the boy came in , as usual , through the little green gate in the red - brick fruit - wall at [the bottom of [the garden]201-the garden]315-the bottom of the garden . From the first , [he]129-the boy had taken this privilege , which as a matter of fact had never been accorded to [anybody]1354-anybody .

[The Professor]211-the professor always entered by the front door , placed [his]211-the professor umbrella in the stand , wet or shine ; left [his]211-the professor goloshes on the mat : hung up [his]211-the professor cap and gown , and followed [Jenkins]60-jenkins into [the drawing - room]319-the drawing - room . Though [he]211-the professor had called regularly , twice a week , during the last dozen years first on [[his]211-the professor old friend and tutor]320-his old friend and tutor , [Professor Charteris]70-professor charteris ; after [his]70-professor charteris death , on [[his]70-professor charteris widow]321-his widow and [daughter]322-daughter ; and , when [Miss Charteris]69-miss charteris was left alone , on [herself]69-miss charteris only [he]211-the professor never failed to knock and ring ; nor did [he]211-the professor ever enter unannounced .

[The Boy]129-the boy had dashed in at the garden gate on the occasion of [his]129-the boy second visit , and appeared to consider that [he]129-the boy had thus created a precedent which should always be followed .

Once , and once only on [her]69-miss charteris thirtieth birthday [the Professor]211-the professor had brought [Miss Charteris]69-miss charteris a bouquet ; but , being very absent - minded , [he]211-the professor deposited the bouquet on the mat , and advanced into [the drawing - room]319-the drawing - room carrying [his]211-the professor goloshes in [his]211-the professor left hand . Having shaken hands with [his]211-the professor right , [he]211-the professor vaguely presented the goloshes . [Miss Charteris]69-miss charteris , never at a loss where [[her]69-miss charteris friends]326-her friends were concerned , took [the Professor]211-the professor 's goloshes from [his]211-the professor hand , carried [them]328-them out into [the hall]329-the hall , found the bouquet on the mat , and saved the situation by putting the flowers in water , and thanking [the Professor]211-the professor with somewhat more hilarity than the ordinary presentation of a bouquet would have called forth .

But to return to the second day . [The Boy]129-the boy arrived in flannels , and tea was a merry meal . [The Boy]129-the boy wanted particulars concerning the marriage , which had taken place a year or so before , between [[Martha]56-martha maid of thirty years ' standing , now acting as cook - housekeeper]333-martha maid of thirty years ' standing , now acting as cook - housekeeper to [Miss Charteris]69-miss charteris and [Jenkins]60-jenkins , [the butler]213-the butler . [The Boy]129-the boy wanted to know which proposed , [Jenkins]60-jenkins or [Martha]56-martha ; in what terms [they]336-they announced the fact of [their]336-they engagement , to [Miss Charteris]69-miss charteris ; whether [Jenkins]60-jenkins ever " bucked up and looked like [a bridegroom]1447-a bridegroom , "[60-jenkins] and whether [Martha]56-martha wore orange - blossom and a wedding veil . [He]129-the boy extorted the admission that [Christobel]48-christobel had been present at the wedding , and insisted on a detailed account ; over which , when given at last , [he]129-the boy slapped [his]129-the boy knee so often , and went into such peals of laughter , that [Miss Charteris]48-christobel glanced anxiously towards the [kitchen]337-kitchen and pantry windows , which unfortunately looked out on [the garden]201-the garden .

[The Boy]129-the boy expatiated on [his]129-the boy enthusiastic admiration for [Martha]56-martha ; but at the same time was jolly well certain [he]129-the boy would have bolted when it came to " [I]129-the boy , [Martha]56-martha , take [thee]56-martha , [Jenkins]60-jenkins , "[129-the boy] had [he]129-the boy stood in [the latter]340-the latter 's shoes . [Miss Charteris]48-christobel did not dare admit , that as a matter of fact the sentence had been : " [I]48-christobel , [Martha]56-martha , take [thee]56-martha , [Noah]71-noah . "[48-christobel] That [the meek Jenkins]60-jenkins should possess so historical and patriarchal a name , would completely have finished [the Boy]129-the boy , who was already taking considerable risks by combining much laughter with an unusually large number of explosive buns .

[The Boy]129-the boy would have it , that , excepting in the rÅ°le of [bride]343-bride and [subsequent conjugal owner]344-subsequent conjugal owner and disciplinarian , [Martha]56-martha was perfect .

[Miss Charteris]48-christobel admitted [Martha]56-martha 's unrivalled excellence as [a cook]345-a cook , [her]56-martha economy in management , and fidelity of heart . But [Martha]56-martha had a temper . Also , though undoubtedly a superficial fault , yet trying to the artistic eye of [Miss Charteris]48-christobel , [Martha]56-martha 's hair was apt to be dishevelled and untidy .

" It is a bit wispy , "[129-the boy] admitted [the Boy]129-the boy , reluctantly . " Why do n't [you]48-christobel tell [her]56-martha so ? "[129-the boy]

[Miss Charteris]48-christobel smiled . " [Boy]1293-boy dear , [I]48-christobel dare n't ! It would be as much as [my]48-christobel place is worth , to make a personal observation to [Martha]56-martha ! "[48-christobel]

" [I]129-the boy 'll tell [her]56-martha for [you]48-christobel , if [you]48-christobel like , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy , coolly .

" If [you]129-the boy do , "[48-christobel] warned [Miss Charteris]48-christobel , " it will be the very last remark [you]129-the boy will ever make in [[Martha]56-martha 's kitchen]1449-martha 's kitchen , [Boy]1293-boy . "[48-christobel]

" Oh , there are ways of telling , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy , airily ; and pinched an explosive bun .

After tea [they]349-they took [their]349-they rackets and strolled down [the lawn]177-the lawn , pausing a moment while [she]48-christobel chose [him]129-the boy a buttonhole . The tie was orange on this second day , and [she]48-christobel gathered the opening bud of a [William Allen Richardson]72-william allen richardson rose . [She]48-christobel smiled into its golden heart as [she]48-christobel pinned it in [his]129-the boy white flannel coat . Somehow it brought a flash of remembrance of the golden heart of [Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue , who could not bear that [any one]351-any one should be past praying for , or that [even a scarecrow]352-even a scarecrow should seem lonely .

[They]349-they crossed [the lane]200-the lane and entered [the paddock]354-the paddock ; tightened the net on the tennis - court ; chose out half a dozen brand - new balls , and settled down to fast and furious singles .

[Miss Charteris]48-christobel played as well as [she]48-christobel had ever played in [her]48-christobel life ; but [the Boy]129-the boy was off [his]129-the boy service , and [she]48-christobel beat [him]129-the boy six to four . Next time , [he]129-the boy pulled off ' games all , ' but lost the set ; then was beaten , three to six .

[Miss Charteris]48-christobel was glowing with the exercise , and the consciousness of being in great form .

" [Boy]52-little boy blue dear ! "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel called , as [she]48-christobel played the winning stroke of the third set , " [I]48-christobel 'm afraid [you]129-the boy 're lazy to - day ! "[48-christobel]

[The Boy]129-the boy won the next set .

It was deliciously cool and quiet under the mulberry - tree .

[The Boy]129-the boy was quite subdued for [him]129-the boy . [He]129-the boy seemed inclined to do [his]129-the boy marching in silence , on this second day .

[Miss Charteris]48-christobel felt [her]48-christobel mental balance restored . [She]48-christobel held the reins to - day , and began considering how to deal wisely with [the Boy]129-the boy . So much depended upon how [she]48-christobel managed [him]129-the boy .

" [Boy]1293-boy , [Boy]1293-boy ! [I]129-the boy know all about [you]1293-boy ! "[52-little boy blue]

" Flying , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy , sitting forward in [his]129-the boy chair . " [I]129-the boy am going to break every record . This week , if [I]129-the boy had not stayed on [here]1478-here [you]52-little boy blue know originally [I]129-the boy came up only for the ' May week ' [I]129-the boy was to have done a Channel flight . Ah , [you]52-little boy blue do n't know what it means , to own three flying - machines , all of different make , and each the best of its kind ! [You]52-little boy blue feel [you]52-little boy blue own [the world]1427-the world ! "[129-the boy]

" And if winds are wrong , [Boy]1293-boy ? If [you]1293-boy rush out and take the horrid risks of the cross - currents [you]1293-boy told [us]1484-us about ? If something happens to [your]1293-boy propeller , and [you]1293-boy fall headlong into [the sea]1327-the sea ? "[129-the boy]

" Oh , it 's all U P then , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy , lightly . " But [one]1374-one never expects that sort of thing to happen ; and when it does , all is over so quickly that there is no time for anticipation . Beside , there must be pioneers . Every good life given , advances the cause . "[129-the boy]

[Christobel Charteris]48-christobel looked at [him]129-the boy . [His]368-his was not the terrible , unmistakable , relentless face of [the bird - man]369-the bird - man . And [the Boy]129-the boy was gone . [He]129-the boy had held [her]377-she hand , in a firm , strong clasp , a second longer than the conventional handshake ; [his]129-the boy clear eyes , exactly on a level with [hers]377-she , had looked at [her]377-she gravely , wistfully , tenderly ; and [he]129-the boy was gone .

[She]377-she walked slowly up [the lawn]177-the lawn . [She]377-she must write a few letters before post time ; then dress for [her]377-she solitary dinner .

[She]377-she felt a little flat ; quite without cause . What could have been more satisfactory , in every way , than [the Boy]129-the boy 's visit ; in spite of [his]129-the boy absurd castles in the air ? These must be tactfully demolished to - morrow . To - day , it was wisest just to let [him]129-the boy talk .

[Poor Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue ! Instead of the walls of [Jericho]12-jericho falling , [his]129-the boy own castles in the air would come tumbling about [his]129-the boy ears . [Poor Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue !

[She]377-she felt [she]377-she had been completely mistress of the situation to - day , holding it exactly as [she]377-she wished it to be . There was no need to fear the remaining days .

And when the seven days were over what then ? ... [She]377-she certainly felt very flat this evening . How suddenly [the Boy]129-the boy had gone ! There was still so much [she]377-she wanted to say to [him]129-the boy .... And to - morrow was [the Professor]211-the professor 's afternoon . Mercifully , [he]129-the boy never stayed later than four o'clock . It was to be hoped [the Boy]129-the boy would not turn up early ! But there was never any knowing what [the Boy]129-the boy would do .

[She]377-she smiled as [she]377-she mounted the flight of stone steps , and passed into [the house]384-the house .

And , outside the postern gate , [the Boy]129-the boy threw up [his]129-the boy cap , and caught it ; then started off and sprinted a hundred yards ; then , turning aside , leapt a five - barred gate , and made off across [the fields]386-the fields . When [he]129-the boy pulled up at last , in [[his]129-the boy own bedroom]387-his own bedroom , [he]129-the boy had just time to tub , shave , and wrestle with [his]129-the boy evening clothes . [He]129-the boy communed with [himself]129-the boy in the few moments of enforced stillness , while [he]129-the boy mastered [his]129-the boy tie .

" That was all right , "[129-the boy] [he]129-the boy said . " [I]129-the boy jolly well worked that all right ! There was nothing to frighten [her]377-she to - day not a thing . [Dear lips]1525-dear lips ! [They]1526-they never trembled once ; and no more turning faint . And , [[my]129-the boy Goody]1527-my goody , how [she]377-she lectured [me]129-the boy ! [I]129-the boy wonder who 's been telling [her]377-she what . [I]129-the boy know why [she]377-she did it too . [She]377-she wanted to feel quite sure [she]377-she was bossing the show . And so [she]377-she was , bless [her]377-she ! But [I]129-the boy marched round ! Yes , [I]129-the boy jolly well marched round .... Oh , [I]129-the boy say ! Ca n't [you]129-the boy stop where [I]129-the boy put [you]129-the boy ? "[129-the boy] This , to [his]388-his tie .

Then , with [her]389-her golden rose in [his]388-his button - hole , fastened by the pin from [his]388-his flannel coat , off went [the Boy]129-the boy to dine with [the Master of [[his]388-his college]392-his college]391-the master of his college .

" And the evening and the morning were the second day . "[52-little boy blue]

THE THIRD DAY

[THE BOY]52-little boy blue INVADES [THE KITCHEN]1259-the kitchen

[The Boy]129-the boy sat on a corner of the kitchen table , swinging a loose leg , and watching [Martha]56-martha make hot buttered - toast .

[He]129-the boy had arrived early , and , finding [no one]1280-no one in [the garden]201-the garden , had entered [the house]384-the house by [the garden]201-the garden - door , to pursue investigations [upstairs]399-upstairs .

On the mat in [the hall]329-the hall [he]129-the boy saw a pair of goloshes ; in the umbrella - stand , a very large , badly - rolled umbrella ; hanging on a peg near by , [a professor]401-a professor 's cap and gown .

[The Boy]129-the boy stood stock still in the middle of [the little hall]403-the little hall , and looked at the goloshes .

Then from [the drawing - room]319-the drawing - room , through the closed door , came the voice of [Miss Charteris]48-christobel full , clear , measured , melodious reading Greek tragedy .

Å¥rrois anaidÅ¥s , Å¥n tÅ chei neanÅªa declaimed [Miss Charteris]48-christobel ; and [the Boy]129-the boy fled .

Arrived in [the kitchen]1259-the kitchen , [he]129-the boy persuaded [Martha]56-martha that cigarette smoke was fatal to black - beetles . [He]129-the boy went about , blowing fragrant clouds into every possible crack and cranny . [Martha]56-martha watched [him]129-the boy , out of the corner of [her]56-martha eye , crawling along under the dresser in [his]129-the boy immaculate white flannels , and [Martha]56-martha blessed [her]56-martha stars that [her]56-martha kitchen floor was so spotlessly clean . Only this morning [she]56-martha had remarked to [Jenkins]60-jenkins that [he]129-the boy could very well eat [his]129-the boy dinner off the boards . Mercifully , [[Jenkins]60-jenkins tiresome man though [he]129-the boy usually was]407-jenkins tiresome man though he usually was had not taken this literally ; or [he]129-the boy might have made the floor less fit for [the Boy]129-the boy 's perambulations .

Having taken all this trouble in order to establish [his]129-the boy unquestioned right to smoke in [[Martha]56-martha 's kitchen]1449-martha 's kitchen , and to pose as [a public benefactor]410-a public benefactor while so doing , [the Boy]129-the boy seated [himself]129-the boy on the edge of the table , exactly behind [Martha]56-martha ; lighted a fresh " Zenith , "[129-the boy] and prepared to enjoy [himself]129-the boy .

[Martha]56-martha glanced nervously at the smoke , issuing from cracks and holes on all sides . It gave [her]56-martha a feeling that [the house]384-the house was on fire . Of course [she]56-martha knew it was not ; but to feel [the house]384-the house is on fire , is only one degree less alarming than to know it is . However , beetles are nasty things ; and the condescending kindness and regard for [Martha]56-martha 's personal comfort , which crawled about after [them]414-them in white flannels , was gratifying to a degree .

So [Martha]56-martha turned and gave [the Boy]129-the boy one of [her]56-martha unusual smiles . [He]129-the boy was very intently blowing rings " bubbles "[56-martha] [Martha]56-martha called them afterwards , when explaining them to [Jenkins]60-jenkins ; but that was [Martha]56-martha 's mistake . [Whereupon the Boy]87-boy lifted the tray , and made for the door .

After that , it was a very happy tea . Neither had been quite natural , nor had [they]465-our been really true to [themselves]465-our , the day before ; so the delight of meeting seemed to follow a longer parting than the actual twenty - four hours . [The Boy]129-the boy 's brown eyes rested in tenderness on the hand that filled [his]129-the boy cup , and [she]48-christobel did not say " Do n't "[48-christobel] ; [she]48-christobel merely smiled indulgently , and added the cream and sugar slowly , as if to let [him]129-the boy do what [he]129-the boy willed .

The hum of bees was in [the garden]201-the garden ; a sense of youth was in the air . The sunbeams danced among the mulberry leaves .

[The Boy]87-boy insisted upon carrying back the tray , to do away at once with the possibility of interruption from [Jenkins]60-jenkins . Then [he]87-boy drew [their]465-our chairs into the deeper shade of the mulberry - tree , a corner invisible from all windows . [The Boy]129-the boy had learned a lesson while looking through [the storeroom blind]469-the storeroom blind .

There [they]465-our sat and talked , in calm content . It did not seem to matter much of what [they]465-our spoke , so long as [they]465-our could lie back facing [one another]470-one another ; each listening to the voice which held so much more of meaning in it than the mere words it uttered ; each looking into the eyes which had now become clear windows through which shone [the soul]471-the soul .

Suddenly [the Boy]129-the boy said : " How silly [we]465-our were , the other day , to talk of the relative ages of [our]465-our bodies . What do they matter ? [Our]465-our souls are the real [you]1587-you and [I.]129-the boy And [our]465-our souls are always the same age . [Some souls]1588-some souls are old old from the first . [I]129-the boy have seen [an old soul]1589-an old soul look out of the eyes of [a little child]1590-a little child ; and [I]129-the boy have seen [a young soul]1591-a young soul dance in the eyes of [an old , old woman]1592-an old , old woman . [You]1587-you and [I]129-the boy , thank [God]64-god , have [young souls]1593-young souls , [Christobel]48-christobel , and [we]465-our shall be eternally young . "[129-the boy]

[He]129-the boy stretched [his]129-the boy arms over [his]129-the boy head , in utter joyful content with life .

" Go on , [Boy]1293-boy dear , "[48-christobel] said [Christobel]48-christobel . " [I]48-christobel am not sure that [I]48-christobel agree with [you]1293-boy ; but [I]48-christobel like to hear [you]1293-boy talk . "[48-christobel]

" At first , "[129-the boy] [he]129-the boy said , " [our]465-our bodies are so babyish that [our]465-our souls do not find them an adequate medium of expression . But by and by [our]465-our bodies grow and develop ; after which come the beautiful years of perfection , ten , twenty , thirty of them , when [the young soul]1595-the young soul goes strong and gay through life , clad in [the strong gay young body]1596-the strong gay young body . Then gradually , gradually , [the strong young soul]1597-the strong young soul , in [its]1597-the strong young soul unwearied , immortal youth , wears out the body . [The body]1598-the body grows old , but not the soul . Nothing can age that ; and when at last the body quite wears out , [the young soul]1595-the young soul breaks free , and begins again . [Youthful souls]1600-youthful souls wear out [their]1600-youthful souls bodies quicker than [old ones]1601-old ones ; just as [a strong young boy]1602-a strong young boy romps through a suit of clothes sooner than [a weakly old man]1603-a weakly old man . But there is always life more abundant , and a fuller life farther on . So the mating of souls is the all - important thing ; and when [young souls]1593-young souls meet and mate , what does it matter if there be a few years ' difference in the ages of [their]1593-young souls bodies ? [Their]1593-young souls essential youthfulness will surmount all that . "[129-the boy]

[Christobel]48-christobel looked at [him]129-the boy , and truly for a moment [the young soul in [her]48-christobel]473-the young soul in her leapt out to [his]129-the boy , in glad response . Then the other side of the question rose before [her]48-christobel .

" Ah , but , [Boy]87-boy dear , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said , " [the souls]1605-the souls express [themselves]1605-the souls [their]1605-the souls needs , [their]1605-the souls delights , [their]1605-the souls activities through the bodies . And suppose [one body , in the soul - union]1606-one body , in the soul - union , is wearing out sooner than the other ; that is hard on the other hard on both . [Boy]1293-boy [my]48-christobel Little Boy Blue shall [I]48-christobel tell [you]87-boy an awful secret ? [I]48-christobel suppose [I]48-christobel sat too closely over [my]48-christobel books at [Girton]17-girton ; [I]48-christobel suppose [I]48-christobel was not sufficiently careful about good print , or good light . Anyway [Boy]87-boy dear [I]48-christobel have to use glasses when [I]48-christobel read . "[48-christobel] [She]48-christobel looked wistfully into [his]474-he bright eyes . " [You]474-he see ? Already [I]48-christobel am beginning to grow old . "[48-christobel] [Her]48-christobel sweet lips trembled .

In a moment [he]474-he was kneeling by the arm of [her]48-christobel chair , bending over [her]48-christobel , as [he]474-he did on the first day ; but as [he]474-he did not do yesterday . Suddenly [she]48-christobel realized why [she]48-christobel had felt so flat yesterday , after [he]474-he was gone .

[He]474-he lifted [her]48-christobel hand and kissed it gently , back and palm . Then [he]474-he parted the third finger from the rest , with [his]474-he own brown ones , and held that against [his]474-he warm young lips .

[She]48-christobel drew [her]48-christobel hand slowly away ; passed it over [his]474-he hair ; then let it fall upon [her]48-christobel lap . [She]48-christobel could not speak ; [she]48-christobel could not move ; [she]48-christobel could not send [him]474-he away . [She]48-christobel wanted [him]474-he so [her]48-christobel little Boy Blue , of long ago .

" Old , [[my]474-he Beloved]1608-my beloved ? "[474-he] [he]474-he said . " [You]1608-my beloved old ! Never ! Always perfect perfect to [me]474-he . And why not wear glasses ? [Heaps of mere kids]1609-heaps of mere kids wear glasses , and wear them all the time . Only how alarmingly clever [you]1608-my beloved must look in spectacles , [Christobel]48-christobel . It would terrify [me]474-he now ; but by and by it will make [me]474-he feel proud . [I]474-he think [one]1374-one would expect glasses to go with those awe - inspiring classical honours . With [my]474-he barely respectable B.A. , [I]474-he dare n't lay claim to any outward marks of erudition . "[474-he] Then , as [she]48-christobel did not smile , but still gazed up at [him]474-he , wistfully , [his]474-he look softened to still deeper tenderness : " Dear eyes , "[474-he] [he]474-he murmured , " oh dear , dear eyes , "[474-he] and gently laid [his]474-he lips on each in turn .

" Do n't , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said , with a half sob . " Ah , [Boy]1293-boy , do n't ! [You]1293-boy know [you]1293-boy must not kiss [me]48-christobel . "[48-christobel]

" Kiss [you]48-christobel ! "[474-he] [he]474-he said , still bending over [her]48-christobel . " Do [you]48-christobel call that kissing ? "[474-he]

[He]474-he bent above [her]48-christobel . [His]474-he lips were very near to [hers]48-christobel . [She]48-christobel closed [her]48-christobel eyes and waited . [She]48-christobel forgot to remember the past ; [she]48-christobel forgot to consider the future . So [she]48-christobel closed [her]48-christobel eyes and waited .

[She]48-christobel did not hear [him]474-he go ; but presently [she]48-christobel knew [he]474-he was no longer there .

[She]48-christobel opened [her]48-christobel eyes .

[The Boy]129-the boy had walked across [the lawn]177-the lawn , and stood looking into the golden heart of an opening yellow rose . [His]129-the boy back appeared very uncompromising ; very determined ; very erect .

[She]48-christobel rose and walked over to [him]129-the boy . As [she]48-christobel moved forward , with the graceful dignity of motion which was always [hers]48-christobel , [her]48-christobel mental balance returned .

[She]48-christobel slipped [her]48-christobel hand beneath [his]129-the boy arm . " Come , [Boy]52-little boy blue , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said ; " let [us]478-they walk up and down , and talk . It is enervating to sit too long in the sunshine . "[48-christobel]

[He]129-the boy turned at once , suiting [his]129-the boy step to [hers]48-christobel , and [they]478-they paced [the lawn]177-the lawn in silence .

When [they]478-they reached the postern gate [the Boy]129-the boy stood still . Something in [his]129-the boy look suddenly recalled [her]48-christobel Little Boy Blue , when the sand on [his]129-the boy small nose could not detract from the dignity of [his]129-the boy little face , nor weaken its stern decision .

[He]129-the boy took both [her]48-christobel hands in [his]129-the boy , and looked into [her]48-christobel eyes .

" [Christobel]48-christobel , "[129-the boy] [he]129-the boy said , " [I]129-the boy must go . [I]129-the boy must go , because [I]129-the boy dare not stay . And [he]129-the boy went .

It was hard to hear the thud of the closing door . For some time [she]48-christobel stood waiting , just on the inside . [She]48-christobel thought [he]129-the boy would come back , and [she]48-christobel wished [him]129-the boy to find [her]48-christobel there , the moment [he]129-the boy opened the door .

But [the Boy]129-the boy being [the Boy]129-the boy did not come back .

Presently [she]48-christobel returned to [her]48-christobel chair , in the shade of the mulberry - tree . [She]48-christobel lay , with closed eyes , and lived again through the afternoon , from the moment when [the Boy]129-the boy had said : " Hip , hip , hurrah ! "[129-the boy] There came a time when [she]48-christobel turned very pale , and [her]48-christobel lips trembled , as [they]484-they had done before .

At length [she]48-christobel rose and paced slowly up [the lawn]177-the lawn . On [her]48-christobel face was the quiet calm of an irrevocable decision .

" To - morrow , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said , " [I]48-christobel must tell [the Boy]129-the boy about [the Professor]211-the professor . "[48-christobel]

In the middle of the night , [Martha]56-martha , being wakeful , became haunted by the remembrance of the smoke , as it had curled from cracks and keyholes in [the kitchen]1259-the kitchen . [She]56-martha felt constrained to put on a wonderful pink wrapper , and go creaking slowly down the stairs to make sure [the house]384-the house was not on fire . [Martha]56-martha 's wakefulness was partly caused by the unusual fact of a large and hard curl - paper , behind [her]56-martha left ear .

[Miss Charteris]48-christobel was also awake . [She]48-christobel was not worried by memories of smoke , or visions of fire ; and [her]48-christobel soft hair was completely innocent of curl - papers . But [she]48-christobel was considering how [she]48-christobel should tell [the boy]129-the boy about [the Professor]211-the professor ; and that consideration was not conducive to calm slumber . [She]48-christobel heard [Martha]56-martha go creaking down [the stairs]490-the stairs ; and , as [Martha]56-martha came creaking up again , [she]56-martha opened [her]56-martha door , and confronted [her]56-martha .

" What are [you]56-martha doing , [Martha]56-martha ? "[56-martha] [she]56-martha said .

[Martha]56-martha , intensely conscious of [her]56-martha curl - paper , was about to answer with more than [her]56-martha usual respectful irritability , when the eyes of [the two women mistress]491-the two women mistress and [maid]492-maid met , in the light of [their]491-the two women mistress respective candles , and a sudden sense of fellowship in the cause of [their]491-the two women mistress night vigil passed between [them]491-the two women mistress .

[Martha]56-martha smiled a crooked smile , half ashamed to be seen smiling . When [she]56-martha spoke , [her]56-martha aspirates fell away from [her]56-martha more completely than in the daytime .

" ' [E]56-martha went crawlin ' about [the kitchen]1259-the kitchen , "[56-martha] [she]56-martha said , in a muffled midnight whisper ; " all in ' is white flannels , puffin ' smoke in every crack an ' ' ole to kill the beetles . ' [Ow]89-ow came [you]56-martha to be awake , [Miss Christobel]48-christobel ? "[56-martha]

" Things [he]1620-he said in [the garden]201-the garden , [Martha]56-martha , have given [me]56-martha food for thought . [I]56-martha began thinking them over ; and sleep went . "[56-martha]

[Martha]56-martha smiled again and this time the smile came more easily . " And the evening and the morning were the third day . "[495-the sweet mother]

THE FOURTH DAY

[CHRISTOBEL]48-christobel SIGNS [HER]48-christobel NAME

" [I]129-the boy am exhausted , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy , reaching out a long arm , and securing [his]129-the boy third piece of hot buttered - toast . " [I]129-the boy am ruffled . "[129-the boy] [He]129-the boy lay back in the depths of [his]129-the boy chair , stretched out [his]129-the boy legs , and looked dejectedly at [Christobel]48-christobel .

[Her]48-christobel quiet smile enveloped [him]129-the boy . [Her]48-christobel look was as a cool touch on a hot forehead .

" [Poor Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue ! [I]48-christobel thought something was wrong . [I]48-christobel should feel a keener anxiety , were the hot buttered - toast less obviously consoling . "[48-christobel]

" [I]129-the boy 'll jolly well never go again , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy , with indignation . " Not [me]129-the boy ! "[129-the boy]

"[48-christobel]

" [I]129-the boy 've been to a [drawing - room meeting]1628-drawing - room meeting , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy , " and [I]129-the boy 've heard [a woman hold forth]1629-a woman hold forth . "[129-the boy]

" [I]48-christobel thought [you]129-the boy seemed finding them extra long , [Boy]1293-boy . Why did [you]129-the boy go to [a drawing - room meeting]1633-a drawing - room meeting ? "[48-christobel]

" [I]129-the boy went , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy , " because [the dear old thing in whose house it was held]1634-the dear old thing in whose house it was held asked [me]129-the boy to go . [The Boy]129-the boy took an explosive bun , and put it whole into [his]129-the boy mouth . " [I]129-the boy do n't think [you]1251-dear need be afraid , [Boy]52-little boy blue dear . " Oh , [she]1646-the good lady meandered on , "[129-the boy] grumbled [the Boy]129-the boy . " [She]1646-the good lady told [us]1647-we all [we]1647-we should have been , if [we]1647-we had not been what [we]1647-we were ; and all [we]1647-we might be , if [we]1647-we were not what [we]1647-we are ; and all [we]1647-we shall be , when [we]1647-we are not what [we]1647-we are ! ' "[505-i]

" [I]48-christobel do n't want to hear any more , [Boy]1293-boy . [I]48-christobel always enjoy appreciations , even of things [I]48-christobel do not [myself]48-christobel appreciate . "[48-christobel]

[The Boy]129-the boy stood up and brought [his]129-the boy cup to the little table . When [she]509-her had filled it , [he]129-the boy knelt on one knee beside [her]509-her , [his]129-the boy elbow on the arm of [her]509-her chair , and drank [his]129-the boy tea there .

" [I]129-the boy am sorry , [dear]1251-dear , "[129-the boy] [he]129-the boy said , presently . " [I]129-the boy wo n't do it again . [The old garden]132-the old garden was very still . A hush , as of [the Paradise of [God]64-god]511-the paradise of god , seemed suddenly to fall upon it . As [the Boy]129-the boy asked [his]129-the boy quiet question , a spirit seemed to hover , between [them]513-them and the green dome of mulberry leaves above [them]513-them , smoothing [the Boy]129-the boy 's tumbled hair , and touching the noble brow of [the woman [the Boy]129-the boy loved]515-the woman the boy loved ; [a gentle , watching , thankful spirit]517-a gentle , watching , thankful spirit eternally remembering , and tenderly glad to be remembered . For a few moments the silence was a silence which could not be broken . [The Boy]129-the boy lifted wondering eyes to the moving leaves . [Christobel]48-christobel laid [her]48-christobel hand upon [his]129-the boy , as it gripped [her]48-christobel chair . An unseen voice seemed to whisper to [the Boy]129-the boy not in the stern tones of [the Church]520-the church , but as an eager , anxious , question : " Wilt [thou]1662-thou have [this woman]1663-this woman to be [[thy]1662-thou wedded wife]1664-thy wedded wife ? "[129-the boy] And silently [the Boy]129-the boy replied : " Please [God]64-god , [I]129-the boy will "[129-the boy] ; and , bending , kissed the hand resting on [his]129-the boy .

The spell lifted . [Christobel]48-christobel spoke .

" Yes , [Boy]52-little boy blue dear , [I]48-christobel knew [her]1663-this woman . [I]48-christobel have often wondered whether [I]48-christobel might tell [you]52-little boy blue . Another long holy silence . The mulberry leaves were still . " And the evening and the morning were the fourth day . "[48-christobel]

THE FIFTH DAY

[GUY CHELSEA TAKES CONTROL]94-guy chelsea takes control

" Now , [Sir Boy]95-sir boy , "[48-christobel] said [Miss Charteris]48-christobel with decision , " this is [your]95-sir boy fifth day . [Our]1670-our time is nearly over . [You]95-sir boy have done most of the talking . [You]95-sir boy have had things entirely [your]95-sir boy own way . What ? ... Oh , well , almost entirely [your]95-sir boy own way . [I]48-christobel have allowed [you]95-sir boy to play [your]95-sir boy Old Testament game to [your]95-sir boy heart 's content . With commendable adaptability , [I]48-christobel have been [Jericho]12-jericho , and [you]95-sir boy have marched round . [I]48-christobel have been [Jericho]12-jericho in [[my]48-christobel own garden]1671-my own garden , and have refreshed [the invading army]1672-the invading army with hot buttered - toast and explosive buns . Now it is [my]48-christobel turn to take the initiative . [Jenkins]60-jenkins having removed the tea , and it being too hot for tennis , [I]48-christobel am going to ask [you]95-sir boy to sit still , while [I]48-christobel explain to [you]95-sir boy quite clearly why [I]48-christobel must send [you]95-sir boy away at the close of the seventh day . "[48-christobel]

[She]526-her tried to hide [her]526-her extreme trepidation beneath a tone of gay banter . [She]526-her hoped it did not sound as forced to [him]527-him as it did to [herself]526-her . " Yes , as [a woman]275-a woman loves a book ; but not as [a woman]275-a woman loves [a man]1407-a man . "[557-me]

" [Boy]1293-boy ! [Boy]1293-boy ! Come back , "[48-christobel] said [Christobel]48-christobel . But the door had closed on the first word .

[She]564-she stood alone .

This time [she]564-she did not wait . Where was the good of waiting ?

[She]564-she turned and walked slowly up [the lawn]177-the lawn , pausing to look at the flowers in the border . The yellow roses still looked golden . The jolly little " what - d'-you - call-'ems "[564-she] lifted pale purple faces to the sky .

But [the Boy]129-the boy was gone .

[She]564-she reached [her]564-she chair , where [he]129-the boy had placed it , deep in the shade of the mulberry - tree . [She]564-she felt tired ; worn - out ; old .

[The Boy]129-the boy was gone .

[She]564-she leaned back with closed eyes . [She]564-she had hurt [him]129-the boy so . [She]564-she remembered all the glad , sweet confident things [he]129-the boy had said each day . Now [she]564-she had hurt [him]129-the boy so .... What radiant faith , in love and in life , had been [his]129-the boy . But [she]564-she had spoiled that faith , and dimmed that brightness .

Suddenly [she]564-she remembered [[his]129-the boy dead mother]571-his dead mother 's prayer for [him]129-the boy . " [I]571-his dead mother have prayed for [thee]129-the boy , that [thy]129-the boy faith fail not . "[571-his dead mother] And under those words [she]564-she had written " [Christobel]48-christobel . [He]129-the boy was dining with [friends]1464-friends , but an unaccountable restlessness seized [him]129-the boy during the evening . " [Boy]1293-boy dear , [I]129-the boy must see [you]1293-boy at once . [You]1293-boy will find [me]129-the boy in [the garden]201-the garden .[129-the boy]

" [Christobel]48-christobel . "[129-the boy]

When [the Boy]129-the boy had turned the corner and disappeared , [Miss Charteris]48-christobel passed through the little postern gate , and moved slowly up [the lawn]177-the lawn . Ah , how different to [her]48-christobel sad return from that gate an hour before !

[The William Allen Richardsons]99-the william allen richardsons still opened [their]99-the william allen richardsons golden hearts to the sunset . The jolly little " what - d'-you - call-'ems "[99-the william allen richardsons] still lifted [their]99-the william allen richardsons purple faces to the sky . But instead of stabbing [her]48-christobel with agony , [they]99-the william allen richardsons sang a fragrant psalm of love .

Ah , why was [the Boy]129-the boy so dear ? Why was [the Boy]129-the boy so near ? [She]48-christobel had watched [him]129-the boy go striding down [the lane]200-the lane , yet [he]129-the boy still walked beside [her]48-christobel ; [his]129-the boy gay young laugh of glad content was in [her]48-christobel ears ; [his]129-the boy pure young kisses on [her]48-christobel brow and eyes ; [his]129-the boy head against [her]48-christobel knee .

Just as [she]48-christobel reached the mulberry , [Jenkins]60-jenkins hastened from [the house]384-the house . The note [he]129-the boy brought , in a familiar handwriting , thin and pointed , was marked " urgent "[129-the boy] in one corner , and " immediate "[129-the boy] in the other ; but [Miss Ann]51-miss ann 's notes usually were one or other . This happened to be both .

" [You]60-jenkins need not wait , [Jenkins]60-jenkins , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said .

[She]48-christobel stood close to a spreading branch of [the mulberry]596-the mulberry . [Her]48-christobel tall head was up among the moving leaves . Whispering , [they]597-they caressed [her]48-christobel . Something withheld [her]48-christobel from entering the soft shade , sacred to [herself]48-christobel and [the Boy]129-the boy . [She]48-christobel stood , to read [Ann Harvey]97-ann harvey 's letter .

As [she]48-christobel read , every vestige of colour left [her]48-christobel face . Bending over the letter , [she]48-christobel might have been [a sorely troubled and perplexed replica of [the noble Venus of [Milo]25-milo]600-the noble venus of milo]599-a sorely troubled and perplexed replica of the noble venus of milo .

Folding the letter , [she]48-christobel went slowly up [the lawn]177-the lawn , still wearing that white look of cold dismay . [She]48-christobel spoke to [Martha]56-martha through the open window , keeping [her]56-martha face out of sight .

" [Martha]56-martha , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said , " [I]48-christobel am obliged to go immediately to [Miss Ann]51-miss ann . If [I]48-christobel am not back by eight o'clock , [I]48-christobel shall be remaining with [her]51-miss ann for dinner . "[48-christobel] [She]48-christobel passed on , and [Martha]56-martha turned to [Jenkins]60-jenkins .

By the way , [Jenkins]60-jenkins was having an unusually festive time . During the last twenty - four hours , [Martha]56-martha had been kinder to [him]602-he than [he]602-he had ever known [her]56-martha to be . [He]602-he was now comfortably ensconced in the Windsor armchair in a corner of [the kitchen]1259-the kitchen , reading yesterday 's daily paper , and enjoying [his]602-he pipe . Never before had [his]602-he pipe been allowed in [the kitchen]1259-the kitchen ; but [he]602-he had just been graciously told [he]602-he might bring it in , if [he]602-he would n't be " messy with the hashes "[60-jenkins] ; [Mrs. Jenkins]60-jenkins volunteering the additional remarkable information , that it was " good for the beetles . "[60-jenkins] [Jenkins]60-jenkins was doubtful as to whether this meant that [his]602-he pipe gave pleasure to the beetles , or the reverse ; but experience had taught [him]602-he that a condition of peaceful uncertainty in [his]602-he own mind was to be preferred to a torrent of vituperative explanation from [Martha]56-martha . [He]602-he therefore also received in silence the apparently unnecessary injunction not to go " crawlin ' about all over the floor "[56-martha] ; it took " a figure to do that ! "[56-martha]

[Eight o'clock]100-eight o'clock came , and [Miss Charteris]48-christobel had not returned .

" Remaining with ' er for dinner , "[56-martha] pronounced [Martha]56-martha , flinging open the oven , and wrathfully relegating to the larder the chicken [she]56-martha had been roasting with extreme care ; " an ' a precious poor dinner it 'll be ! [Jenkins]60-jenkins , [you]60-jenkins may ' ave this sparrow - grass . [I]56-martha ' aven't the ' eart . Now what 's took [Miss Hann]86-miss hann ' urgent and immediate , ' [I]56-martha 'd like to know ! "[56-martha] continued [Martha]56-martha , deriving considerable comfort from banging the plates and tumblers on to the kitchen table , with just as much violence as was consistent with [their]605-their personal safety , as [she]56-martha walked round [it]606-it , laying the table for supper . " Ate a biscuit , [I]56-martha should think , an ' flown to ' er cheat . [I]56-martha 've no patience ; no , that [I]56-martha ' aven't ! "[56-martha] And [Martha]56-martha attacked the loaf , with fury .

At a quarter before nine , [Miss Charteris]48-christobel returned . In a few moments the bell summoned [Jenkins]60-jenkins . The note [he]607-he was to take was also marked " Immediate . "[607-he] [He]607-he left it on the kitchen table , and , while [he]607-he changed [his]607-he coat , [Martha]56-martha fetched [her]56-martha glasses . Then [she]56-martha followed [him]607-he to [the pantry]1573-the pantry .

" ' Ere , [run man]1828-run man ! "[56-martha] [she]56-martha said , " run ! Never mind [your]129-the boy muffler . Who wants a muffler in June ? ' E 's in it ! It 's something more than a biscuit . Drat [that woman]1331-that woman ! "[56-martha]

A quarter of an hour later , [a tall white figure]609-a tall white figure moved noiselessly down [the lawn]177-the lawn , to the seats beneath the mulberry . The full moon was just rising above the high red wall , gliding up among the trees , huge and golden through their branches . [Christobel Charteris]48-christobel waited in [the garden]201-the garden for [the Boy]129-the boy .

[He]607-he came .

By then , [the lawn]177-the lawn was bathed in moonlight . [She]56-martha saw [him]607-he , tall and slim , in the conventional black and white of [a man]1407-a man 's evening dress , pass silently through the postern gate . [She]56-martha noted that [he]607-he did not bang it . [He]607-he came up [the lawn]177-the lawn slowly for [him]607-he . [He]607-he wore no hat , and every clear - cut feature of [the clean - shaven young face]616-the clean - shaven young face showed up in the moonlight .

At the mulberry , [he]607-he paused , uncertain ; peering into the dark shadow .

" [Christobel]48-christobel ? "[607-he] [he]607-he said , softly .

" [Boy dear]1296-boy dear ; [I]607-he am here . Come . "[607-he]

[He]607-he came ; feeling [his]607-he way among the chairs , and moving aside a table , which stood between .

[He]607-he found [her]56-martha , sitting where [he]607-he had found [her]56-martha , on [his]607-he return , three hours before . A single ray of moonlight pierced the thick foliage of the mulberry , and fell across [her]56-martha face . [He]607-he marked its unusual pallor . [He]607-he stood before [her]56-martha , put one hand on each arm of [her]56-martha chair , and bent over [her]56-martha .

" What is it ? "[607-he] [he]607-he said , softly . " What is it , [dear heart]1831-dear heart ? It is so wonderful to be wanted , and sent for . But let [me]607-he know quickly that [you]56-martha are not in any trouble . "[607-he]

[She]56-martha looked up at [him]607-he dumbly , during five , ten , twenty seconds . Then [she]56-martha said : " [Boy]1293-boy , [I]56-martha have something to tell [you]607-he . Will [you]607-he help [me]56-martha to tell it ? "[56-martha]

" Of course [I]607-he will , "[607-he] [he]607-he said . " How can [I]56-martha help best ? "[56-martha]

" [I]56-martha do n't know , "[56-martha] [she]56-martha answered . " Oh , [I]56-martha do n't know ! "[56-martha]

[He]607-he considered a moment . Then [he]607-he sat down on the grass at [her]56-martha feet , and leaned [his]607-he head against [her]56-martha knees . [She]56-martha passed [her]56-martha fingers softly through [his]607-he hair .

" What happened after [I]129-the boy had gone ? "[129-the boy] asked [the Boy]129-the boy .

" Well ? "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy , gently . The pause was so very long , that it seemed to require supplementing . [He]129-the boy felt for the other hand , which had been holding the lace at [her]56-martha breast , and drew it to [his]129-the boy lips . It was wet with tears .

[The Boy]129-the boy started . [He]129-the boy sat up ; turned , resting [his]129-the boy arm upon [her]56-martha lap , and tried to see [her]56-martha face .

" Time is nothing , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy , suddenly . " [You]625-her and [I]129-the boy are [one]1374-one , [Christobel]48-christobel ; eternally , indissolubly one . [She]625-her hesitated . [The Boy]129-the boy 's theories were so vital , so vigorous , so assured . Was [she]625-her making a mistake ? There was no question as to the pain involved by [her]625-her decision ; but was that pain to result as [she]625-her believed , in higher good to all ; or was it to mean irreparable loss ? The very knowledge that [her]625-her body so yearned for [him]129-the boy , led [her]625-her to emphasize the fact that [the Boy]129-the boy could not oh surely could not be a fit mate for [her]625-her mind . Yet [he]129-the boy was so confident , so sure of [himself]129-the boy , in regard to [her]625-her , on every point ; so unhesitatingly certain that [they]628-they were meant for each other .

And then [she]625-her saw [Ann Harvey]97-ann harvey , with clasped hands , saying : " [Darling child]1872-darling child , forgive [me]97-ann harvey , but [I]97-ann harvey had to tell [Kenrick]98-kenrick !
