[She]625-her could see [Miss Ann]51-miss ann 's delicate wrinkled face ; the tearful eyes ; the lavender ribbons on [her]51-miss ann lace cap ; the mysterious hair - brooch , fastening the old lace at [her]51-miss ann neck . The scene was photographed upon [her]625-her memory ; for , in that moment , [Hope]105-hope [the young Hope]629-the young hope , born of [the youthful Boy]630-the youthful boy and [his]630-the youthful boy desires had died . [Christobel Charteris]48-christobel had taken up the burden of life ; a life apart from the seven days ' romance , created by the amazing over - confidence of [[her]48-christobel Little Boy Blue]304-her little boy blue .

[The masterful man]632-the masterful man attracts ; but , in the end , it is usually [the diffident man who wins]633-the diffident man who wins . The innate unselfishness of [the noblest type of woman]634-the noblest type of woman , causes [her]634-the noblest type of woman to yield more readily to the insistence of [her]634-the noblest type of woman pity than to the force of [her]634-the noblest type of woman desire . In these cases , marriage and martyrdom are really though unconsciously synonymous ; and the same pure , holy courage which went smiling to the stake , goes smiling to the altar . Does [a martyr]635-a martyr 's crown await it , in [another world]636-another world ? Possibly . The only perplexing question , in these cases , being : What awaits the wrecked life of " [the other man]1874-the other man "[48-christobel] ?

[Christobel Charteris]48-christobel had put [her]48-christobel hand to the plough ; [she]48-christobel would not look back .

" [Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said , " [you]52-little boy blue must say ' good - bye ' and go . "[48-christobel]

Then [the Boy]52-little boy blue 's anguish broke through all bounds . [He]637-his flung [his]637-his arms around [her]48-christobel , and hid [his]637-his face in [her]48-christobel lap . A sudden throb of speechless agony seemed to overwhelm [them]638-them both , submerging all arguments , all casuistry , all obligations to [others]639-others , in a molten ocean of love and pain .

Then [she]48-christobel heard [the Boy]129-the boy pray : " [O God]1876-o god , give [her]48-christobel to [me]129-the boy ! Give [her]48-christobel to [me]129-the boy ! [O God]64-god , give [her]48-christobel to [me]129-the boy ! "[129-the boy]

" Hush , [Boy]52-little boy blue , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said ; " oh , hush ! "[48-christobel]

[He]637-his was silent at once .

[He]637-his had never seemed so completely [her]48-christobel own [Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue as in that moment , when [she]48-christobel listened to [his]637-his hopeless prayer : " O [God]64-god , give [her]52-little boy blue to [me]48-christobel ! "[48-christobel] This was [the Little Boy Blue who tried to carry cannon - balls]641-the little boy blue who tried to carry cannon - balls ; who faced [the world]1427-the world , with sand upon [his]637-his nose ; cloudless faith in [his]637-his bright eyes ; indomitable courage in [his]637-his heart . " Oh , [[my]48-christobel Little [Boy Blue]52-little boy blue , [my]48-christobel Little Boy Blue]1877-my little boy blue , my little boy blue ! "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said .

Suddenly [she]48-christobel felt [the Boy]129-the boy 's hot tears upon [her]48-christobel neck .

Then , in undreamed of pain , [her]48-christobel heart stood still . Then the full passion of [her]48-christobel tenderness awoke , and found voice in an exceeding bitter cry .

" Oh , [I]129-the boy can not bear it ! [I]129-the boy can not bear it ! [Boy]1293-boy dear , oh , [Boy dear]1296-boy dear , [you]1293-boy shall have all [you]1293-boy wish all all ! ... Silence under the mulberry - tree ; the silence of a great decision .

Then [he]129-the boy drew [himself]129-the boy gently but firmly from [her]48-christobel arms .

[He]129-the boy stood before [her]48-christobel , tall , erect , unbending . The moonlight fell upon [his]129-the boy face . [It]649-it had lost its look of youth , taking on a new power . " No , [Christobel]48-christobel , "[129-the boy] [he]129-the boy said . " No , [[my]129-the boy Beloved]1608-my beloved . [You]1293-boy 've been heavenly good to [me]129-the boy , [dear]1251-dear ; and [I]129-the boy 've put [you]1293-boy through so much . [I]129-the boy will go up to [town]1886-town to - night . "[129-the boy]

[He]652-he stooped and took both [her]653-her hands in [his]652-he ; lifted them reverently , tenderly , to [his]652-he lips ; held them there one moment , then laid them back upon [her]653-her lap , and turned away .

[She]653-her saw [him]652-he walk down [the moonlit lawn]654-the moonlit lawn , tall and erect . [She]653-her saw [him]652-he pass through the gate , without looking back . [She]653-her heard it close quietly not with [the old boyish bang]655-the old boyish bang yet close irrevocably , decisively .

Then [she]653-her shut [her]653-her eyes , and began again to rock gently to and fro . [Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue was still in [her]653-her arms ; it comforted [her]653-her to rock [him]652-he there . But [the man who had arisen and left [her]653-her , when [he]652-he might , taking advantage of [her]653-her weakness , have won [her]653-her against [her]653-her own conscience and will]656-the man who had arisen and left her , when he might , taking advantage of her weakness , have won her against her own conscience and will ; [the man who , mastering [his]652-he own agony , had thus been brave and strong for [her]653-her]657-the man who , mastering his own agony , had thus been brave and strong for her had carried [her]653-her whole heart with [him]652-he , when [he]652-he went out through the postern gate .

In rising , [he]652-he left [the Boy]129-the boy in [her]653-her arms . Through the long hard years to come , [she]653-her prayed [she]653-her might keep [him]652-he there [[her]653-her own Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue .

But [he]652-he who went out alone , for [her]653-her sake to face life without [her]653-her , was [the man [she]653-her loved]659-the man she loved .

[She]653-her knew it , at last .

" And the evening and the morning were the fifth day . "[653-her]

THE SIXTH DAY

[MISS ANN HAS " MUCH TO SAY "]51-miss ann[653-her]

On the afternoon of the sixth day , at the hour which had hitherto been kept for [the Boy]129-the boy , [Christobel Charteris]48-christobel , in response to another urgent and immediate summons , went to take tea with [Miss Ann]51-miss ann .

It had been a long , dull , uneventful day , holding at first a certain amount of restless uncertainty as to whether [the Boy]129-the boy was really gone ; mingled with apprehensive anticipation of a call from [the Professor]211-the professor .

But before noon a reply - paid telegram arrived from [the Boy]129-the boy , sent off at [Charing Cross]26-charing cross .

" Good morning . All 's well . Just off for [Folkestone]13-folkestone . Please tell [me]129-the boy how [you]129-the boy are . "[129-the boy]

To which , while [Jenkins]60-jenkins and [the telegraph - boy]664-the telegraph - boy waited , [Miss Charteris]48-christobel replied :

" Quite well , thank [you]129-the boy . Do be careful at [Folkestone]13-folkestone . "[48-christobel]

and afterwards thought of many other messages which [she]653-her might have sent , holding more , and better expressed . But that precious moment in touch with [the Boy]129-the boy passed so quickly ; and it seemed so impossible to think of anything but commonplace words , while [Jenkins]60-jenkins stood at attention near the table ; and [the telegraph - boy]664-the telegraph - boy kept ringing [his]664-the telegraph - boy bicycle - bell outside , as a reminder that [he]664-the telegraph - boy waited .

Yet [her]653-her heart felt warmed and comforted by this momentary contact with [the Boy]129-the boy . [He]129-the boy still cared to know how [she]653-her was . And it was so like [him]129-the boy to put : " All 's well . "[129-the boy] [He]129-the boy wished [her]653-her to know [he]129-the boy had not gone down beneath [his]129-the boy trouble . " [Fanks]61-fanks , but [I]129-the boy always does [my]129-the boy own cawwying . "[129-the boy] [Brave Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue , of long ago !

The expectation of [the Professor]211-the professor 's note or call remained , keeping [her]653-her anxious ; until [she]653-her heard from [Ann Harvey]97-ann harvey , that [[her]653-her brother]1848-her brother had been obliged to go to [London]2-london on business , and would not return until the evening . " Come to tea with [me]211-the professor , [dear child]1890-dear child , "[211-the professor] the note concluded ; " [we]1891-we have much to say ! "[211-the professor]

It seemed to [Christobel]48-christobel that there remained nothing which [Miss Ann]51-miss ann had not already said , in every possible form and way . Nevertheless , [she]653-her put on [her]653-her hat , and went . [Miss Ann]51-miss ann had succeeded in impressing [all [her]51-miss ann friends]670-all her friends with the conviction that [her]51-miss ann wishes must never be thwarted .

[Miss Ann]51-miss ann had named [[her]51-miss ann villa]671-her villa " [Shiloh]27-shiloh , "[51-miss ann] undoubtedly a suitable name , so far as [she]51-miss ann [herself]51-miss ann was concerned ; [her]51-miss ann time being mostly spent upon a comfortable sofa in [[her]51-miss ann tiny drawing - room]672-her tiny drawing - room ; or reclining on a wicker lounge beneath the one tree in [[her]51-miss ann small garden]673-her small garden ; or being carefully wheeled out in a bath - chair .

But [nobody else]1852-nobody else found [[Miss Ann]51-miss ann 's villa]675-miss ann 's villa in any sense a " resting - place . "[51-miss ann] [She]51-miss ann had a way of keeping everybody about [her]51-miss ann from jaded [Emma]108-emma to [the most casual caller on the move]676-the most casual caller on the move , while [she]51-miss ann [herself]51-miss ann presented a delicate picture of frail inactivity . Immediately upon [their]677-they arrival , [[her]51-miss ann friends]326-her friends found an appointed task awaiting [them]677-they ; but it was always something which [Miss Ann]51-miss ann would have given to [somebody else to do]679-somebody else to do , had [they]677-they not chanced at that moment to appear ; and [they]677-they were usually left with the feeling that [the particular somebody else whose privilege [they]677-they , in [their]677-they well - meant zeal , had usurped]680-the particular somebody else whose privilege they , in their well - meant zeal , had usurped would have accomplished it better .

Directing [them]677-they from the sofa , [Miss Ann]51-miss ann kept [[her]51-miss ann entourage]681-her entourage busy and perpetually on the move . Yet [she]51-miss ann never felt [she]51-miss ann was asking much of [them]677-they ; nor , however weary at the conclusion of the task , did [they]677-they ever feel much had been accomplished , owing to the judicious use of the word " just . "[51-miss ann]

" [[My]51-miss ann dear]1892-my dear , "[51-miss ann] [Miss Ann]51-miss ann would say , " as [you]1892-my dear are [here]1478-here , will [you]1892-my dear just clean the canary ? "[51-miss ann] Cleaning the canary meant a very thorough turning out of an intricate little brass cage ; several journeys up and down stairs in quest of sand , seed , and brass polish , and an out - door excursion to [[a neighbour]682-a neighbour 's garden]683-a neighbour 's garden for groundsel . [The canary]684-the canary 's name was " [Sweetie - weet]109-sweetie - weet , "[684-the canary] and , however much annoyed [[Miss Ann]51-miss ann 's friends]685-miss ann 's friends might be feeling with the canary , [they]685-miss ann 's friends had to call [him]684-the canary " [Sweetie - weet]109-sweetie - weet "[684-the canary] all the time [they]685-miss ann 's friends " cleaned [him]684-the canary , "[685-miss ann 's friends] lest [his]684-the canary flutterings should upset [Miss Ann]51-miss ann . Now [you]686-you can not say " [Sweetie - weet]109-sweetie - weet "[686-you] in an angry voice . Try , and [you]686-you will see . [Consequently [Miss Ann]51-miss ann 's friends]687-consequently miss ann 's friends had no vent for [their]685-miss ann 's friends feelings during the process of getting a rather large hand in and out of a very small brass door with a spring , which always snapped to , at the wrong moment , while the hand , which seemed to its possessor larger than it had ever seemed before , was crooked round in an impossible position in a strained attempt to fix [Sweetie - weet]109-sweetie - weet 's perches . If anything went wrong during the cleaning process , [Miss Ann]51-miss ann , from [her]51-miss ann vantage - ground on the sofa would sigh , and exclaim : " [Poor patient little Sweetie - weet]1894-poor patient little sweetie - weet ! "[51-miss ann] [Miss Ann]51-miss ann was in full possession of all [her]51-miss ann faculties . [Her]51-miss ann hearing was preternaturally sharp . It was no use saying " Fiend ! When the task was completed , the cage had to be brought to [[Miss Ann]51-miss ann 's couch]688-miss ann 's couch for inspection . [She]51-miss ann then usually discovered the perches to have been put back before they were perfectly dry . Now nothing as surely [you]686-you hardly ought to require to be told was so prejudicial to [Sweetie - weet]109-sweetie - weet 's delicate constitution as to have damp wood beneath [his]684-the canary precious little feet . Consequently all the perches had just to be taken out again , dried before the kitchen fire , and put back once more . When this mandate went forth , the glee in the bright black eyes in [Sweetie - weet]109-sweetie - weet 's yellow head was unmistakable . [He]684-the canary shared [Miss Ann]51-miss ann 's mania for keeping [people]689-people busy .

When [Christobel Charteris]48-christobel arrived at [Shiloh]27-shiloh , [she]48-christobel found [Miss Ann]51-miss ann on the green velvet sofa , looking very frail and ethereal ; a Shetland shawl about [her]51-miss ann shoulders , fastened by the largest and most mysterious of [her]51-miss ann hair - brooches a gold - mounted oval brooch , in which a weeping willow of fair hair drooped over a sarcophagus of dark hair ; while a crescent moon of grey hair kept watch over both . This funereal collection of family hair always possessed a weird fascination for [small children]694-small children , brought by [[their]694-small children parents]695-their parents to call upon [Miss Ann]51-miss ann . The most undemonstrative became affectionate , and hastened with ready docility to the sofa to kiss [Miss Ann]51-miss ann , in order to obtain a closer view , and to settle the much disputed point as to the significance of a small round object in the left - hand corner at the bottom . [Miss Ann]51-miss ann wept gently for a while . [Christobel]48-christobel sat silent . [Her]48-christobel recent experience of tears , wrung from such deep anguish of soul , made it less easy for [her]48-christobel to feel sympathetic towards tears which flowed from no apparent cause , and fell delicately into perfumed lace . So [she]48-christobel waited in silence , while [Miss Ann]51-miss ann wept .

[The room]704-the room was very still . The bang with which [the Boy]129-the boy usually made [his]129-the boy entry anywhere , would have been terrific in its joyful suddenness . Besides [the Boy]52-little boy blue was gone . Oh , silent , sober , sorry world ! [The Boy]129-the boy was gone .

[Sweetie - weet]109-sweetie - weet put [his]129-the boy head on one side , and chirped interrogatively . In [his]129-the boy judgment , the silence had lasted sufficiently long .

An hour later , somewhat tired in body , and completely exhausted in mind , [Miss Charteris]48-christobel walked [home]1583-home . [She]48-christobel opened [it]728-it , and passed in .

A shaft of sunlight lay along [the lawn]177-the lawn . [The jolly little " what d'-you - call-'ems]1950-the jolly little " what d'-you - call-'ems "[1950-the jolly little " what d'-you - call-'ems] lifted gay purple faces to the sky .

[She]48-christobel paused in the doorway , trying to realize how [this quiet green seclusion]730-this quiet green seclusion , the old - fashioned flower - borders , [the spreading mulberry - tree]731-the spreading mulberry - tree , [the quaint white house]732-the quaint white house , in the distance , with [its]732-the quaint white house green shutters , must have looked to [the Boy]129-the boy each day , as [he]129-the boy came in . [She]48-christobel knew [he]129-the boy had more eye for colour , and more knowledge of artistic effect , than [[his]129-the boy casual acquaintances]734-his casual acquaintances might suppose . [She]48-christobel would not need to refer to the catalogue for [the artist]737-the artist 's name . [The Boy]52-little boy blue had had a painting in [the Academy]738-the academy the year before . [She]48-christobel had chanced to see it . It hung on the line . [She]48-christobel had been struck by its thoughtful beauty , and wealth of imaginative skill . [She]48-christobel had not forgotten that picture ; and during all these days [she]48-christobel had been quietly waiting to hear [the Boy]129-the boy say [he]129-the boy had had a painting in [the Academy]738-the academy . Then [she]48-christobel was going to tell [him]129-the boy [she]48-christobel had seen it , had greatly admired it , and had noted with pleasure all the kind things [critics]742-critics had said of it .

But , the subject of pictures not having come up , it had not occurred to [the Boy]129-the boy to mention it . [The Boy]129-the boy never talked of what [he]129-the boy had done , because [he]129-the boy had done it . But were a subject mentioned upon which [he]129-the boy was keen , [he]129-the boy would bound up , with shining eyes , and tell [you]745-you all [he]129-the boy knew about it ; all [he]129-the boy had seen , heard , and done ; all [he]129-the boy was doing , and all [he]129-the boy hoped to do in the future , in connexion with that particular thing . [He]129-the boy would never have thought of informing [you]745-you that [he]129-the boy owned [three aeroplanes]746-three aeroplanes . But if the subject of aviation came up , and [you]745-you said to [the Boy]129-the boy : " Do [you]129-the boy know anything about it ? "[745-you] [he]129-the boy would lean forward , beaming at [you]745-you , and say : " [I]129-the boy should jolly well think [I]129-the boy do ! "[129-the boy] and talk [aeroplanes]1505-aeroplanes to [you]745-you for as long as [you]745-you were willing to listen . This trait of [the Boy]129-the boy 's , caused [shallow - minded people]750-shallow - minded people to consider [him]129-the boy conceited . But [the woman [he]129-the boy loved]751-the woman he loved knew how to distinguish between keenness and conceit ; between exuberant enthusiasm and egotistical self - assertion ; and [the woman who loved [him]129-the boy]752-the woman who loved him , smiled tenderly as [she]752-the woman who loved him remembered that even on the day when [she]752-the woman who loved him scolded [him]129-the boy , and [he]129-the boy had to admit [his]129-the boy " barely respectable B.A. , "[752-the woman who loved him] [he]129-the boy had not told [her]752-the woman who loved him of the painting hung on the line and mentioned in the Times . Yet if the question of art had come up , [the Boy]129-the boy would very probably have sat forward in [his]129-the boy chair , and talked about [his]129-the boy painting , straight on end , for half an hour .

[She]752-the woman who loved him still stood beneath the archway , in the red - brick wall , as these thoughts chased quickly through [her]752-the woman who loved him mind . [She]752-the woman who loved him would have made a fair picture for [any one who had chanced to be waiting beneath the mulberry - tree , with eyes upon the gate]754-any one who had chanced to be waiting beneath the mulberry - tree , with eyes upon the gate .

" Straight on end for half an hour , [he]129-the boy would have talked about [his]129-the boy picture ; and how bright [his]129-the boy eyes would have been . And then [I]752-the woman who loved him should have said : ' [I]752-the woman who loved him saw it , [Boy dear]1296-boy dear ; and it was quite as beautiful as [you]1296-boy dear say . ' And [he]129-the boy would have answered : ' It jolly well gave [you]752-the woman who loved him the feeling of the scene , did n't it , [Christobel]48-christobel ? ' And [I]752-the woman who loved him should have known that [his]129-the boy delight in it , as an artistic success , had nothing to do with the fact that it was painted by [himself]129-the boy . Just because egotism is impossible to [him]129-the boy , [he]129-the boy is free to be so full of vivid enthusiasm . "[752-the woman who loved him]

[She]752-the woman who loved him smiled again . A warm glow seemed to enfold [her]752-the woman who loved him . " How well [I]752-the woman who loved him know [[my]752-the woman who loved him Boy]1952-my boy ! "[752-the woman who loved him] [she]752-the woman who loved him said aloud ; then remembered with a sudden pang that [she]752-the woman who loved him must not call [him]755-he [[her]752-the woman who loved him Boy]756-her boy . [She]752-the woman who loved him had let [him]755-he go . [She]752-the woman who loved him was very probably going to marry [the Professor]211-the professor . [She]752-the woman who loved him had not with the whole of [her]752-the woman who loved him being wanted [him]755-he to stay , until [he]755-he had had the manliness to rise up and go . Then it had been too late . Ah , was it too late ? If [the Boy]129-the boy came back to plead once more ? "[755-he] would [she]752-the woman who loved him not answer : " Yes , [Guy]94-guy chelsea takes control . Love is all "[755-he] ?

The blood rushed into [her]752-the woman who loved him sweet proud face . That [she]752-the woman who loved him should unconsciously call [him]755-he so in [her]752-the woman who loved him heart , gave [her]752-the woman who loved him another swift moment of self - revelation .

[She]752-the woman who loved him closed the gate gently , careful not to let it bang . As [she]752-the woman who loved him passed up [the lawn]177-the lawn , [her]752-the woman who loved him heart stood still . It seemed to [her]752-the woman who loved him that [he]755-he must be waiting , in the shade of the mulberry - tree .

[She]752-the woman who loved him hardly dared to look . [She]752-the woman who loved him felt so sure [he]755-he was there .... Yes , [she]752-the woman who loved him knew [he]755-he was there .... [She]752-the woman who loved him felt certain [the Boy]129-the boy had come back . [He]755-he could not stay away from [her]752-the woman who loved him on [his]755-he sixth day . No , that would not be quite honest , knowing [he]755-he was [there]1369-there ; and [they]767-they were always absolutely honest with [one another]470-one another .

[She]752-the woman who loved him passed , breathlessly , under the drooping branches . [Her]752-the woman who loved him cheeks glowed ; [her]752-the woman who loved him lips were parted . [Her]752-the woman who loved him eyes shone with love and expectation .

[She]752-the woman who loved him lifted a hanging bough , and passed beneath .

[His]755-he chair was there , and [hers]752-the woman who loved him ; but they were empty . [The Boy]129-the boy being [the Boy]129-the boy had not come back .

Presently [she]752-the woman who loved him went slowly up to [the house]384-the house .

A telegram lay on the hall table . [She]752-the woman who loved him knew at once from whom it came . There was but [one person who carried on a correspondence by telegraph]772-one person who carried on a correspondence by telegraph . Reply paid was written on the envelope .

[She]752-the woman who loved him stood quite still for a moment . Then [she]752-the woman who loved him opened it slowly . [He]129-the boy would be out of [his]129-the boy chair , and sitting at [her]752-the woman who loved him feet , before [she]752-the woman who loved him knew [he]129-the boy was going to move .

[She]752-the woman who loved him opened it slowly , turned to a window , and read it .

" How are [you]129-the boy , [dear]1251-dear ? Please tell [me]752-the woman who loved him . [I]752-the woman who loved him am going to do [my]752-the woman who loved him big fly to - morrow . [She]752-the woman who loved him took up the reply - paid form and wrote :

" Quite well . Good luck ; but please be careful , [Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue . "[752-the woman who loved him]

[She]752-the woman who loved him hesitated a moment , before writing the playful name by which [she]752-the woman who loved him so often called [him]129-the boy . But [his]129-the boy telegram was so absolutely [the Boy]129-the boy , all over . It was best [he]129-the boy should know nothing of " [the man [she]752-the woman who loved him loved , "[752-the woman who loved him] who had gone out at the gate]1954-the man she loved , " who had gone out at the gate . It was best [he]129-the boy should not know what [she]752-the woman who loved him would have called [him]129-the boy , had [he]129-the boy been under the mulberry just now . [She]752-the woman who loved him was undoubtedly going to marry [the Professor]211-the professor . In which case [she]752-the woman who loved him would never call [the Boy]129-the boy anything but " [Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue . "[752-the woman who loved him] So [she]752-the woman who loved him put it into [her]752-the woman who loved him telegram , as a repartee to [his]129-the boy audacious " dear . "[752-the woman who loved him] Then [she]752-the woman who loved him went out , and sent it off [herself]752-the woman who loved him . It was comforting to have something , however small , to do for [him]129-the boy .

[She]752-the woman who loved him came in again ; dressed for the evening , and dined . [She]752-the woman who loved him was thoroughly tired ; and one sentence beat itself incessantly against the mirror of [her]752-the woman who loved him reflection , like a frightened bird with a broken wing : " [He]129-the boy is going to do a big fly to - morrow .... [He]129-the boy is going to do a big fly to - morrow ! [Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue is going to fly and break the record . "[752-the woman who loved him]

[She]752-the woman who loved him sat in the stillness of [[her]752-the woman who loved him drawing - room]777-her drawing - room , and tried to read . But between [her]752-the woman who loved him eyes and the printed page , burned in letters of fire : " [He]129-the boy is going to fly to - morrow . "[752-the woman who loved him]

[She]752-the woman who loved him went down [the garden]201-the garden to the chairs beneath the mulberry - tree . It was cooler there ; but the loneliness was too fierce an agony .

[She]752-the woman who loved him walked up and down [the lawn]177-the lawn , now bathed in silvery moonlight . " [He]129-the boy is going to do a big fly to - morrow . [He]129-the boy jolly well means to break the record . "[752-the woman who loved him]

[She]752-the woman who loved him passed in , and went to [[her]752-the woman who loved him bedroom]780-her bedroom . [She]752-the woman who loved him lay in the darkness and tried to sleep . [She]752-the woman who loved him tried in vain . What if [he]781-he got into cross - currents ? What if the propeller broke ? What if the steering - gear twisted ? [She]752-the woman who loved him began remembering every detail [he]781-he had told [herself]752-the woman who loved him and [Mollie]53-mollie ; when [she]752-the woman who loved him sat listening , thinking of [him]781-he as [[Mollie]53-mollie 's lover]782-mollie 's lover , though all the while [he]781-he had been [[her]752-the woman who loved him Little Boy [Blue]52-little boy blue]52-little boy blue .... " Oh of course then it is all U P. But there must be [pioneers]1955-pioneers ! "[52-little boy blue]

At last [she]752-the woman who loved him could bear it no longer . [She]752-the woman who loved him lighted [her]752-the woman who loved him candle , and rose . [She]752-the woman who loved him went to [[her]752-the woman who loved him medicine cupboard]783-her medicine cupboard , and did a thing [she]752-the woman who loved him had never done before , in the whole of [her]752-the woman who loved him healthy life . [She]752-the woman who loved him took a sleeping draught . The draught was one of [Miss Ann]51-miss ann 's ; left behind at the close of a recent visit . [She]752-the woman who loved him knew it contained chiefly bromide ; harmless but effective .

[She]752-the woman who loved him put out the light , and lay once more in darkness .

The bromide began to act .

[The bird with the broken wing]784-the bird with the broken wing became less insistent .

[The absent Boy]52-little boy blue drew near , and bent over , kneeling beside [her]752-the woman who loved him .

[She]752-the woman who loved him talked to [him]784-the bird with the broken wing softly . [Her]752-the woman who loved him voice sounded far away , and unlike [her]752-the woman who loved him own . " Be careful , [Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue , "[752-the woman who loved him] [she]752-the woman who loved him said . " [You]784-the bird with the broken wing may jolly well what an expression ! break the record if [you]784-the bird with the broken wing like ; but do n't break [yourself]784-the bird with the broken wing ; because , if [you]784-the bird with the broken wing do , [you]784-the bird with the broken wing will break [my]752-the woman who loved him heart . "[752-the woman who loved him]

The bromide was acting strongly now . [The bird with the broken wing]784-the bird with the broken wing had gone . There was a strange rhythmical throbbing in [her]752-the woman who loved him ears . It was [[the Boy]129-the boy 's aeroplane]787-the boy 's aeroplane ; but it had started without [him]784-the bird with the broken wing . [She]752-the woman who loved him knew sleep was coming ; merciful oblivion . Yet now [she]752-the woman who loved him was too happy to wish to sleep .

[The Boy]129-the boy drew nearer .

" Oh , [Boy]52-little boy blue dear , [I]752-the woman who loved him love [you]52-little boy blue so , "[752-the woman who loved him] [she]752-the woman who loved him whispered into the throbbing darkness ; " [I]752-the woman who loved him love [you]52-little boy blue so . "[752-the woman who loved him]

" [I]129-the boy know [you]752-the woman who loved him do , [dear]1251-dear , "[129-the boy] said [the Boy]129-the boy . " It is almost unbelievable , [Christobel]48-christobel ; but [I]129-the boy know [you]752-the woman who loved him do . "[129-the boy]

Then [she]752-the woman who loved him put up [her]752-the woman who loved him arms , and drew [him]129-the boy to [her]752-the woman who loved him breast .

Thus [the Boy]129-the boy though far away marched round .

" And the evening and the morning were the sixth day . "[752-the woman who loved him]

AN INTERLUDE

" AS A DREAM , WHEN [ONE]113-one AWAKETH "[752-the woman who loved him]

When [Miss Charteris]48-christobel opened [her]48-christobel eyes , the sun was streaming into [[her]48-christobel room]791-her room . The sense of having slept heavily and unnaturally lay upon [her]48-christobel . [She]48-christobel had not heard [Martha]56-martha 's entry ; but [her]48-christobel blinds were up , and the tea on the tray beside [her]48-christobel bed was still fresh and hot .

[She]48-christobel took a cup , and the after - effects of the bromide seemed to leave [her]48-christobel .

[She]48-christobel dressed , and went [downstairs]792-downstairs .

On the breakfast - table , beside [her]48-christobel plate , lay [the Professor]211-the professor 's letter . When [she]48-christobel had poured out [her]48-christobel coffee and buttered [her]48-christobel toast , [she]48-christobel opened and read it .

The letter was exactly such as [she]48-christobel had always dreamed [the Professor]211-the professor would write , if [he]211-the professor ever came to the point of making [her]48-christobel a proposal . [He]211-the professor touched on [their]795-their long friendship ; on how much it had meant to [them]795-their both . [He]211-the professor said [he]211-the professor had often hoped for the possibility of a closer tie , but had not felt justified in suggesting it , until [he]211-the professor was in a position to offer [her]48-christobel a suitable home and income . This was now fortunately the case ; therefore [he]211-the professor hastened to write and plead [his]211-the professor cause , though keenly conscious of how little there was in [himself]211-the professor calculated to call forth in [a woman]275-a woman the affection which it was [his]211-the professor earnest hope and desire to win . [She]48-christobel had trusted [him]211-the professor as [a friend]1476-a friend , [an intellectual guide and comrade]798-an intellectual guide and comrade , during many years . If [she]48-christobel could now bring [herself]48-christobel to trust [him]211-the professor in a yet more intimate relation , [he]211-the professor would endeavour never to disappoint or fail [her]48-christobel .

The letter was signed :

" [Yours]48-christobel in sincere devotion , "[98-kenrick] [KENRICK HARVEY]98-kenrick . "[98-kenrick]

A postscript requested to be allowed to call , at the usual hour , that afternoon , for a reply .

[Miss Charteris]48-christobel wrote a brief note of thanks and appreciation , and gave [the Professor]211-the professor leave to call at three .

[The Professor]211-the professor called at three .

[He]211-the professor knocked and rang , and fumbled long over the umbrella - stand in [the hall]329-the hall . [He]211-the professor seemed to be taking all the umbrellas out , and putting them back again .

At last [he]211-the professor appeared at the door of [the drawing - room]319-the drawing - room , where [Miss Charteris]48-christobel awaited [him]211-the professor . [He]211-the professor was very nervous . [He]211-the professor repeated the substance of [his]211-the professor letter , only rather less well expressed . [He]211-the professor alluded to [Miss Ann]51-miss ann , and to the extreme happiness and pleasure to [her]51-miss ann of having [Christobel]48-christobel as [a sister]803-a sister . But [he]211-the professor completely ignored , both in the letter and in conversation , [Miss Ann]51-miss ann 's betrayal of [Christobel]48-christobel 's confidence . For this [she]51-miss ann was grateful to [him]211-the professor .

As soon as [the Professor]211-the professor , having floundered through the unusual waters of expressed sentiment , stepped out on to the high and dry path of an actual question , [Miss Charteris]48-christobel answered that question in the affirmative , and accepted [the Professor]211-the professor 's offer .

[He]211-the professor rose , and held [her]51-miss ann hand for a few moments , looking at [her]51-miss ann with great affection through [his]211-the professor glasses , which did not at all impede the warmth of [his]211-the professor regard ; in fact , being powerful convex lenses , they magnified it . Then [he]211-the professor kissed [her]51-miss ann rather awkwardly on the brow , and hurried back to [his]211-the professor seat .

A somewhat strained silence would have followed , had not [the Professor]211-the professor had an inspiration .

Drawing a book from [his]211-the professor pocket , [he]211-the professor looked at [her]51-miss ann as [you]807-you look at [a child for whom [you]807-you have a delightful surprise in store]808-a child for whom you have a delightful surprise in store .

" That er matter being satisfactorily settled , [[my]211-the professor dear]1892-my dear [Christobel]48-christobel , "[211-the professor] [he]211-the professor said , ' should [we]809-we not find it decidedly er refreshing to spend an hour over [our]809-we Persian translation ? "[211-the professor]

[Miss Charteris]48-christobel agreed at once ; but while [the Professor]211-the professor read , translated , and expounded , expatiating on the interest and beauty of various passages , [her]48-christobel mind wandered .

[She]48-christobel found [herself]48-christobel picturing [the Boy]129-the boy under similar circumstances ; how [the Boy]129-the boy would have behaved during the first hour of engagement ; what [the Boy]129-the boy would have said ; what [the Boy]129-the boy would have done . [She]48-christobel was not quite sure what [the Boy]129-the boy would have done ; [she]48-christobel had never experienced [the Boy]129-the boy with the curb completely off . But [she]48-christobel suddenly remembered : " [Millions]114-millions , or would it be billions ? "[48-christobel] and the recollection gave [her]48-christobel a shock of such vivid reaction , that [she]48-christobel laughed aloud .

[The Professor]211-the professor paused , and looked up in surprise . Then [he]211-the professor smiled , indulgently .

" [[My]211-the professor dear]1892-my dear er [Christobel]48-christobel , this passage is not intended to be humorous , "[211-the professor] [he]211-the professor said .

" [I]48-christobel know it is not , "[48-christobel] replied [Miss Charteris]48-christobel . " [I]48-christobel beg [your]211-the professor pardon . [I]48-christobel laughed involuntarily . "[48-christobel]

[The Professor]211-the professor resumed [his]211-the professor reading .

No ; [she]48-christobel was not quite sure as to all [the Boy]129-the boy would have done ; but [she]48-christobel knew quite well what [he]129-the boy would have said .

And here [the Boy]129-the boy , quite unexpectedly , took a First in classics ; for what [the Boy]129-the boy would have said would certainly have been Greek to [the Professor]211-the professor .

After this , events followed one another so rapidly that the whole thing became dream - like to [Miss Charteris]48-christobel . [She]48-christobel found [herself]48-christobel helpless in the grip of [Miss Ann]51-miss ann 's iron will up to now , carefully shrouded in Shetland and lace . At last [she]48-christobel understood why [[Emma]108-emma 's old mother]823-emma 's old mother had had to die alone in [a little cottage away in [Northumberland]28-northumberland]824-a little cottage away in northumberland ; [Emma]108-emma , [good soul]1945-good soul , being too devoted to [[her]108-emma mistress]826-her mistress to ask for the necessary week , in order to go [home]1583-home and nurse [[her]108-emma mother]828-her mother . [Emma]108-emma had seemed [a broken woman]829-a broken woman , ever since ; and [Christobel]48-christobel understood now the impossibility of [any one]351-any one ever asking [Miss Ann]51-miss ann for a thing which [Miss Ann]51-miss ann had made up [her]51-miss ann mind not to grant .

[She]51-miss ann and [the Professor]211-the professor now became puppets in [Miss Ann]51-miss ann 's delicate hands . [Miss Ann]51-miss ann lay upon [her]51-miss ann couch , and pulled the wires . [The Professor]211-the professor danced , because [he]211-the professor had not the discernment to know [he]211-the professor was dancing ; [Miss Charteris]48-christobel , because [she]48-christobel had not the heart to resist . [The Boy]129-the boy having gone out of [her]48-christobel life , nothing seemed to matter . It was [her]48-christobel duty to marry [the Professor]211-the professor , and there is nothing to be gained by the postponement of duty .

But it was [Miss Ann]51-miss ann who insisted [on the wedding taking place within a week]835-on the wedding taking place within a week . [It]836-it was [Miss Ann]51-miss ann who reminded [them]837-them that , the Long Vacation having just commenced , [the Professor]211-the professor could easily be away , and there were researches connected with [his]211-the professor Encyclopedia which it was of the utmost importance [he]211-the professor should immediately make in [the museums and libraries of [Brussels]29-brussels]839-the museums and libraries of brussels . It was [Miss Ann]51-miss ann who insisted upon a special licence being obtained , and who overruled [Christobel]48-christobel 's desire to be married by [[her]51-miss ann brother]1848-her brother , [the bishop]1273-the bishop . [Miss Ann]51-miss ann had become quite hysterical at the idea of [the bishop]1273-the bishop being brought back from a tour [he]1273-the bishop was making in [Ireland]30-ireland , and [Christobel]48-christobel yielded the more readily , because [[her]51-miss ann brother]1848-her brother 's arrival would undoubtedly have meant [Mollie]53-mollie 's ; and [Mollie]53-mollie 's presence , even if [she]51-miss ann refrained from protest and expostulation , would have brought such poignant memories of [the Boy]129-the boy .

So it came to pass , with a queer sense of the whole thing being dream - like and unreal , that [Miss Charteris]48-christobel who should have had the most crowded and most popular wedding in [Cambridge]16-cambridge found [herself]48-christobel standing , as [a bride]845-a bride , beside [the Professor]211-the professor , in [an ill - ventilated church]847-an ill - ventilated church , at ten o'clock in the morning , being married by [an old clergyman [she]48-christobel had never seen before , who seemed partially deaf , and partially blind , and wholly inadequate to the solemn occasion]848-an old clergyman she had never seen before , who seemed partially deaf , and partially blind , and wholly inadequate to the solemn occasion ; with [Miss Ann]51-miss ann and [[her]51-miss ann faithful Emma]849-her faithful emma , sniffing in a pew on one side ; while [Jenkins]60-jenkins breathed rather heavily in a pew , on the other . [Martha]56-martha had flatly refused to attend ; and when [Miss Charteris]48-christobel sent for [her]56-martha to bid [her]56-martha good - bye , [Martha]56-martha had appeared , apparently in [her]56-martha worst and most morose temper ; then had suddenly broken down , and , exclaiming wildly : " ' [Ow]89-ow about ' [i]56-martha m ? "[56-martha] had thrown [her]56-martha apron over [her]56-martha head , and left [the room]704-the room , sobbing .

" How about [him]211-the professor ? How about [him]211-the professor ? "[48-christobel]

Each turn of the wheels reiterated the question as [she]48-christobel drove to [Shiloh]27-shiloh to pick up [Miss Ann]51-miss ann ; then on to [the church]520-the church where [the Professor]211-the professor waited .

How about [him]211-the professor ? But [he]211-the professor had left [her]48-christobel to do that which [she]48-christobel felt to be right , and [she]48-christobel was doing it .

Nevertheless , [Martha]56-martha 's wild outburst had brought [the Boy]129-the boy very near ; and [he]211-the professor seemed with [her]48-christobel as [she]48-christobel walked up [the church]520-the church .

[Her]48-christobel mind wandered during the reading of the exhortation . In this nightmare of a wedding [she]48-christobel seemed to have no really important part to play . [The Boy]129-the boy would burst in , in a minute ; and a shaft of light would come with [him]211-the professor . [He]211-the professor would walk straight up [the church]520-the church to [her]48-christobel , saying : " [We]857-we have jolly well had enough of this , [Christobel]48-christobel ! "[211-the professor] Then [they]857-we would all wake up , and [he]211-the professor would whirl [her]48-christobel away in a motor and [she]48-christobel would say : " [Boy]52-little boy blue dear ; do n't exceed the speed - limit . "[48-christobel]

But [the Boy]129-the boy did not burst in ; and [the Professor]211-the professor 's hands , looking unusually large in a pair of white kid gloves , were twitching nervously , for an emphatic question was being put to [him]211-the professor by [the old clergyman , who had emerged from [his]860-the old clergyman , who had emerged from his hiding - place behind the prayer - book , as soon as the exhortation was over hiding - place behind the Prayer - book , as soon as the exhortation was over]860-the old clergyman , who had emerged from his hiding - place behind the prayer - book , as soon as the exhortation was over .

[The Professor]211-the professor said : " [I]211-the professor will , "[211-the professor] with considerable emotion ; while [Miss Ann]51-miss ann sobbed audibly into [her]51-miss ann lace pocket - handkerchief .

Oh , [Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue ! [Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue ! [You]1015-you have a way of making hearts stand still .

[The boarding - house]888-the boarding - house proved to be a place decidedly conducive to the taking of a fresh - air cure ; because [nobody]1699-nobody remained within [its]888-the boarding - house four walls , if the weather could possibly admit of [their]1018-they going out .

As soon as [Christobel]48-christobel and [the Professor]211-the professor had taken tea , and replied to [Miss Slinker]115-miss slinker 's many questions , [they]1018-they went out to walk on [the Leas]1411-the leas until sunset . It was a radiant afternoon , and the strong wind which had suddenly arisen , blowing , in unexpected gusts , from [the sea]1327-the sea , acted as a tonic to weary heart and brain . [Christobel]48-christobel , holding on [her]48-christobel hat as [she]48-christobel walked , battled [her]48-christobel way beside [the Professor]211-the professor , up [a cross street]1023-a cross street , into [the Sandgate Road]1024-the sandgate road .

[They]1018-they looked in at [[Parson]1028-parson 's Library]1029-parson 's library just to order a book [Miss Ann]51-miss ann wanted ; and , on a little farther , just to match some crewel silks for a tea - cosy [Miss Ann]51-miss ann was making .

These commissions duly executed , [they]1018-they were free to make [their]1018-they way to [the Leas parade]1030-the leas parade , whence [they]1018-they would look down upon [the beach]1309-the beach , and enjoy a distance view across [the Channel]1014-the channel . [They]1018-they took the side street which brought [them]1018-they out upon [the esplanade]1033-the esplanade , close to the lift by which [people]689-people continuously mounted or descended [the steep face of [the cliff]1036-the cliff]1035-the steep face of the cliff .

[A considerable crowd]1037-a considerable crowd lined the esplanade railing , looking over eagerly . Apparently there was some object of particular interest to be seen below .

[Christobel]48-christobel and [the Professor]211-the professor advanced to the railing , and also looked over .

[She]48-christobel saw a strange thing floating in [the sea]1327-the sea , between [the promenade pier]1040-the promenade pier and [the harbour]1041-the harbour . It seemed a huge insect , with broken wings . Its body was a mass of twisted wires . Around this , a little fleet of [rowing - boats]1042-rowing - boats had gathered . [They]1018-they looked black , on the blue wind - swept waters , like [water - boatmen on [a village pond]1044-a village pond]1043-water - boatmen on a village pond . [They]1018-they darted in and out and round about the wreckage of the huge wings and twisted wire , and seemed waiting for a chance to help .

[A man]1407-a man stood next to [Christobel]48-christobel and [the Professor]211-the professor ; [a man who talked to [himself]1047-a man who talked to himself]1047-a man who talked to himself .

" Ah , [poor chap]1974-poor chap , "[1407-a man] [he]1407-a man said ; " [poor chap ! So nearly back]1975-poor chap ! so nearly back ! So nearly broke the record ! Such a sport ! "[1407-a man]

" What is that thing in [the water]1318-the water ? "[211-the professor] inquired [the Professor]211-the professor .

[The man]643-the man turned and looked at [him]211-the professor .

" [An aeroplane]1977-an aeroplane , "[643-the man] [he]643-the man said , slowly , speaking with a sort of stolid deliberation . " [A wrecked aeroplane]1978-a wrecked aeroplane . Caught in a cross - current , worse luck ! Just accomplished one of the finest flights on record . Started from up here ; skimmed over [the Channel]1014-the channel to [Boulogne]20-boulogne ; circled round [the cathedral]1980-the cathedral such a clear day ; [we]1981-we could watch the whole flight with field - glasses came gaily back without a stop ; was making for [the cliff]1036-the cliff again , when a cross - current caught [him]643-the man ; something went wrong with the steering - gear ; and down it goes , with a plunge , head first into [the sea]1327-the sea . "[643-the man]

" And [the er occupant]1984-the er occupant ? "[211-the professor] inquired [the Professor]211-the professor .

" [The aeronaut]1985-the aeronaut ? Ah , [he]1985-the aeronaut did n't fall clear , worse luck , or [they]1986-they could soon have fished [him]1985-the aeronaut out . " [Guy Chelsea]50-guy chelsea , "[643-the man] said [the man]643-the man . [She]48-christobel could never remember running down those steps . [Every man within sight]1112-every man within sight stood silent and bareheaded .

The golden shaft of sunlight died from off [the sea]1327-the sea .

Then [she]48-christobel came forward , and knelt beside [[her]48-christobel Boy]756-her boy .

Suddenly [she]48-christobel understood the cry of anguish wrung from the loving heart of [a woman at [a tomb]1117-a tomb]1116-a woman at a tomb : " Tell [me]48-christobel where [thou]2021-thou hast laid [Him]1119-the boy her own little boy blue , and [I]48-christobel will take [Him]1119-the boy her own little boy blue away ! "[48-christobel] Oh , faithful heart of [woman , alike through all the ages]1118-woman , alike through all the ages ; ready , with superhuman effort , to prove a limitless love and a measureless grief !

[She]48-christobel knelt beside the stretcher , and lifted the sail - cloth .

Yes , it was [the Boy [her]48-christobel own Little Boy Blue]1119-the boy her own little boy blue .

[The Professor]211-the professor had succeeded in pushing [his]211-the professor way through [the crowd]1073-the crowd , and in mounting [the breakwater]1313-the breakwater . " [Christobel]48-christobel , "[211-the professor] [he]211-the professor said , " this is no place for [you]48-christobel . Come away at once . Do [you]48-christobel hear ? [I]211-the professor bid [you]48-christobel come with [me]211-the professor at once . "[211-the professor]

" [My]48-christobel place is here , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said , clearly and deliberately . " [I]48-christobel have the right to be here . "[48-christobel]

At that moment , [one of [the crowd]1073-the crowd , springing on to [the breakwater behind [the Professor]211-the professor]1127-the breakwater behind the professor]1125-one of the crowd , springing on to the breakwater behind the professor , struck off [his]1125-one of the crowd , springing on to the breakwater behind the professor hat with a cane . [It]1129-it fell into [the sea]1327-the sea .

[The Professor]211-the professor let go [her]48-christobel arm , and turned to see who had perpetrated the outrage , and whether the hat could be recovered .

Then [she]48-christobel bent over the stretcher .

" [Boy dear]1296-boy dear , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel whispered , in tones of ineffable tenderness ; " this is where [they]2028-they have laid [you]1296-boy dear ; but [I]48-christobel will take [you]1296-boy dear away . "[48-christobel]

[She]48-christobel put [her]48-christobel arms beneath the body ; then , with an almost superhuman effort , lifted it , and gathered it to [her]48-christobel . It felt limp and broken . The head fell heavily against [her]48-christobel breast . The blood and salt - water soaked through [her]48-christobel thin muslin blouse . But [she]48-christobel held [him]1125-one of the crowd , springing on to the breakwater behind the professor , and would not let [him]1125-one of the crowd , springing on to the breakwater behind the professor go . " [I]48-christobel will take [him]1125-one of the crowd , springing on to the breakwater behind the professor away , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel whispered ; " [I]48-christobel will take [him]1125-one of the crowd , springing on to the breakwater behind the professor away . "[48-christobel]

[She]48-christobel knew [she]48-christobel was losing [her]48-christobel reason , but [she]48-christobel had known that , ever since [she]48-christobel first looked down from [the top of [the cliff]1036-the cliff]1132-the top of the cliff , and saw the broken wings floating on [the sea]1327-the sea . [She]48-christobel closed [her]48-christobel eyes .

THE SEVENTH]1144-the sea the seventh DAY

THE STONE IS ROLLED AWAY

When [Christobel]48-christobel recovered consciousness and opened [her]48-christobel eyes , [she]48-christobel found [herself]48-christobel in bed , in [[her]48-christobel own room]1145-her own room , at [home]1583-home .

[Martha]56-martha bent over [her]48-christobel .

The morning light entered dimly , through closed curtains .

In dumb anguish of mind , [she]48-christobel looked up into [Martha]56-martha 's grim old face .

" Tell [me]48-christobel where [you]56-martha have laid [him]2029-him , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said , " and [I]48-christobel will take [him]2029-him away . "[48-christobel]

[Martha]56-martha snorted .

" [I]48-christobel 've laid [your]56-martha tea - tray on the table beside [[your]56-martha bed]2030-your bed , [Miss]2031-miss , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said ; " and when [you]56-martha ' ave finished with it , [I]48-christobel will take it away . "[48-christobel]

Whereupon , [Martha]56-martha lumbered to the large bow - window , drew back all the curtains with a vigorous clatter of brass rings , and let in a blaze of morning sunshine .

[Christobel]48-christobel lay quite still , trying to collect [her]48-christobel thoughts .

One of [her]48-christobel pillows was clasped tightly in [her]48-christobel arms .

[She]48-christobel lifted [her]48-christobel left hand , and looked at it .

No ring encircled the third finger .

" [Martha]56-martha , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel called , softly .

[Martha]56-martha loomed large at the side of the bed .

" What is to - day ? "[56-martha]

" Wednesday , [Miss]1624-miss , "[56-martha] replied [Martha]56-martha , too much surprised to be contemptuous .

" [Martha]56-martha where is [Mr. Chelsea]50-guy chelsea ? "[56-martha]

" [Lord]2033-lord only knows , "[56-martha] said [Martha]56-martha , tragically .

" [Martha]56-martha is [he]50-guy chelsea living ? "[56-martha]

" Living ? "[56-martha] repeated [Martha]56-martha , deliberately . Then [she]56-martha smiled , [her]56-martha crooked smile . " Living do n't express it , [Miss Christobel]48-christobel . [Lively]121-lively 's more like it , when [Mr. Guy]50-guy chelsea is concerned . And [I]56-martha reckon , wherever ' [e]2034-e is , [e]2034-e 's makin ' things lively somewhere for [somebody]2035-somebody . [You]48-christobel do n't look quite the thing this morning , [Miss.]122-miss. Sit up and take [your]48-christobel tea . "[56-martha]

[She]56-martha sat up , loosing the pillow out of [her]56-martha arms the pillow which had been , first [her]56-martha Little Boy Blue , as [she]56-martha drew [him]1147-him to [her]56-martha in the darkness ; then the dead body of [Guy Chelsea]50-guy chelsea , as [she]56-martha lifted it on the breakwater .

[She]56-martha took [her]56-martha tea from [Martha]56-martha 's hand , and drank it quickly . [She]56-martha wanted [Martha]56-martha to go .

It was Wednesday ! Then [the Boy]129-the boy had left [her]56-martha only the day before yesterday . [His]129-the boy telegram had come last night . [The Professor]211-the professor 's proposal had not yet reached [her]56-martha .

[Martha]56-martha lifted the tray and departed .

Then [Christobel Charteris]48-christobel rose , and stood at [her]56-martha open window , in the morning sunlight . [She]56-martha looked out upon the mulberry - tree and the long vista of soft turf ; in the dim distance , the postern gate in the old red wall [[his]129-the boy paradise]1150-his paradise , and [hers]56-martha .

[She]56-martha lifted [her]56-martha beautiful arms above [her]56-martha head . The loose sleeves of [her]56-martha nightdress fell away , baring them to the elbows . [She]56-martha might have stood , in [her]56-martha noble development of face and form , for a splendid statue of hope and praise .

" Ah , [dear God]303-dear god ! "[56-martha] [she]56-martha breathed , " is it indeed true ? Is it possible ? Is [[my]56-martha Boy]1952-my boy alive ? And am [I]56-martha free free to be [his]1952-my boy alone ? Am [I]56-martha free to give [him]1952-my boy all [he]1952-my boy wants , free to be all [he]1952-my boy needs ? "[56-martha]

[She]56-martha stood long at the window motionless , realizing the mental adjustment which had come to [her]56-martha during the strenuous hours of the night .

[Her]56-martha dream had taught [her]56-martha one great lesson : That under no circumstances whatever , can it be right for [a woman]275-a woman to marry [one man]1152-one man , while with [her]275-a woman whole being [she]275-a woman loves [another]1153-another . Love is [Lord]1154-lord of all . Love reigns paramount . No expectations , past or present , based on friendship or gratitude ; no sense of duty or obligations of any kind could make a marriage right , if , in view of that marriage , [Love]123-love had to stand by with broken wings .

[She]56-martha felt quite sure , now , that [she]56-martha could never marry [the Professor]211-the professor ; and humbly [she]56-martha thanked [God]64-god for opening [her]56-martha eyes to the wrong [she]56-martha had contemplated , before it was too late .

But there still remained the difficult prospect of having to disappoint [a man [she]56-martha esteemed so highly]1156-a man she esteemed so highly ; [a man who had been led to believe [she]56-martha cared for [him]1156-a man she esteemed so highly , and had waited years for [him]1156-a man she esteemed so highly]1157-a man who had been led to believe she cared for him , and had waited years for him ; [a man who , for years , had set [his]1156-a man she esteemed so highly heart upon [her]56-martha]1158-a man who , for years , had set his heart upon her . This was a heavy stone , and it lay right in the path of perfect bliss which [she]56-martha longed to tread with [[her]56-martha Little Boy Blue]304-her little boy blue .

Who should roll it away ?

Could [she]56-martha feel free to take happiness with [the Boy]129-the boy , if [she]56-martha had disappointed and crushed a deeply sensitive nature which trusted [her]56-martha ?

[She]56-martha dressed , and went down to [the breakfast - room]1161-the breakfast - room , [her]56-martha soul filled , in spite of perplexities , with a radiance of glad thanksgiving .

[Martha]56-martha and [Jenkins]60-jenkins came in to prayers . [Martha]56-martha had now taken to curling all [her]56-martha wisps . [She]56-martha appeared with many frizzled ringlets , kept in place by invisible pins .

[Martha]56-martha always came in to prayers , as if [she]56-martha were marching at the head of a long row of [men]2002-men and [maids]1163-maids . [Jenkins]60-jenkins followed meekly , placing [his]1164-his chair at what would have been the tail of [[Martha]56-martha 's imaginary retinue]1165-martha 's imaginary retinue . According to the triumphant dignity of [Martha]56-martha 's entry , [Jenkins]60-jenkins placed [his]1164-his chair near or far away . [Martha]56-martha was in great form to - day . [Jenkins]60-jenkins sat almost at the door . If the door - bell rang during prayers , the first ring was tacitly ignored ; but if it rang again , [Martha]56-martha signed to [Jenkins]60-jenkins , who tiptoed reverently out , and answered it . No matter how early in the morning 's devotions the interruption occurred , [Jenkins]60-jenkins never considered it etiquette to return . [Miss Charteris]48-christobel used to dread a duet alone with [Martha]56-martha . [She]48-christobel always became too intensely conscious of [herself]48-christobel and of [Martha]56-martha , to be uplifted as usual by the inspired words of Bible and Prayer - book . The presence of [Jenkins]60-jenkins at once constituted [a congregation]1166-a congregation .

On this particular morning , no interruptions occurred .

The portion for the day chanced to be the scene at [the empty tomb]1167-the empty tomb , in the early dawn of that first Easter Day , as given by [Saint Mark]124-saint mark .

The quiet voice vibrated with unusual emotion as [Miss Charteris]48-christobel read :

" And very early in the morning , the first day of the week , [they]2038-us came unto the sepulchre at the rising of the sun . And [they]2038-us said among [themselves]2038-us , Who shall roll [us]2038-us away the stone from the door of the sepulchre ? And when [they]2038-us looked , [they]2038-us saw that the stone was rolled away : for it was very great . "[48-christobel]

[Christobel Charteris]48-christobel paused . [She]48-christobel seemed to see [the shore at [Dovercourt]10-dovercourt]1168-the shore at dovercourt , and the brave little figure struggling to carry the heavy stone ; and , later on when the cannon - ball lay safely in [the castle court - yard]1169-the castle court - yard , [Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue standing erect , with lifted cap , and shining eyes , a picture of faith triumphant .

" [I]52-little boy blue have prayed for [thee]48-christobel , that [thy]48-christobel faith fail not . "[52-little boy blue]

How far were the happenings of this strange night owing to [that dead mother]1170-that dead mother 's prayers ; and to [the Boy]129-the boy 's unfailing faith , even through these hard days ?

[Miss Charteris]48-christobel could read no farther . [She]48-christobel closed the Bible . " Let [us]2038-us pray , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said , and turned to [the Collect]1172-the collect for the week .

" O God , Whose never - failing providence ordereth all things both in [heaven and earth]2039-heaven and earth : [We]2038-us humbly beseech [Thee]48-christobel to put away from [us]2038-us all hurtful things , and to give [us]2038-us those things which be profitable for [us]2038-us ; through [Jesus Christ]125-jesus christ [[our]2038-us Lord]2040-our lord . On the breakfast - table , beside [her]48-christobel plate , lay [the Professor]211-the professor 's letter . [She]48-christobel had known it would be [there]1369-there .

Then [she]48-christobel opened the letter .

" [My]48-christobel dear [Ann]51-miss ann "[48-christobel]

After the nightmare through which [she]48-christobel had just passed , this beginning scarcely surprised [her]48-christobel . [She]48-christobel glanced back at the envelope to make quite sure it was addressed to [herself]48-christobel ; then read on . It was dated the evening before , from [[the Professor]211-the professor 's rooms in [College]45-college]1176-the professor 's rooms in college .

" [[MY]48-christobel DEAR]1892-my dear [ANN]51-miss ann , [I]48-christobel regret to have been unable to look in upon [you]51-miss ann this evening , on [my]48-christobel return from [town]1886-town , and [my]48-christobel duties will keep [me]48-christobel from paying [you]51-miss ann a visit until to - morrow , in the late afternoon . This brought the letter to the bottom of the first page .

" And when [they]2047-they looked , [they]2047-they saw that the stone was rolled away : for it was very great . "[48-christobel]

" [DEAR ANN]111-dear ann , [I]48-christobel enclose a letter from [[your]111-dear ann brother]1905-your brother which came , addressed to [me]48-christobel , this morning , but was evidently intended for [you]111-dear ann . " [Providence]90-providence has indeed interposed , by means of [the Professor]211-the professor 's absent - minded ways , to prevent the wrecking of three lives [mine]48-christobel , [[your]111-dear ann brother]1905-your brother 's , and that of [the man [I]48-christobel love]1800-the man i love ; to whom [I]48-christobel shall be betrothed before the day is over .[48-christobel]

When [Emma]108-emma had duly departed with this letter and enclosure , [Miss Charteris]48-christobel breathed more freely . [She]48-christobel had been afraid lest , in [her]48-christobel righteous indignation , in [her]48-christobel consciousness of the terrible mischief so nearly wrought , [she]48-christobel should write too strongly to [Miss Ann]51-miss ann , thus causing [her]48-christobel unnecessary pain .

It was quite impossible , to the fine generosity of a nature such as that of [Christobel Charteris]48-christobel , really to understand the mean , self - centred , unscrupulous dishonesty of an action such as this of [Miss Ann]51-miss ann 's . From the calm heights whereon [she]51-miss ann walked , such small - minded selfishness of motive did not come within [her]51-miss ann field of vision . [She]51-miss ann could never bring [herself]51-miss ann to believe worse of [Miss Ann]51-miss ann than that , in some incomprehensible way , [she]51-miss ann had laboured under a delusion regarding [herself]51-miss ann and [the Professor]211-the professor .

[Miss Ann]51-miss ann disposed of , [she]51-miss ann turned to [the Professor]211-the professor 's letter .

It was not the letter of [her]51-miss ann dream , by any means ; nor was it the letter [she]51-miss ann had sometimes dreamed [he]211-the professor would write .

It was straightforward and simple ; and , holding the key to the situation , [she]51-miss ann could read between the lines a certain amount of dismayed surprise , which made [her]51-miss ann heartily sorry for [[her]51-miss ann old friend]881-her old friend .

[The Professor]211-the professor touched on [their]1186-their long friendship , [his]211-the professor regard for [[her]51-miss ann parents]1187-her parents , [his]211-the professor sincere admiration for [herself]51-miss ann ; [their]1186-their unity of interests and congeniality of tastes ; [his]211-the professor sudden change of fortunes ; quoted a little Greek , a little Sanskrit , and a little Persian ; then , fortified by these familiar aids to the emotions , offered [her]51-miss ann marriage , in valiant and unmistakable terms .

[Christobel]48-christobel 's heart stood still as [she]51-miss ann realized that not one word in that letter would have revealed to [her]51-miss ann the true state of the case . Truly , under Providence , [she]51-miss ann had cause to bless [the Professor]211-the professor 's " dear absent - minded ways . "[51-miss ann]

As [she]51-miss ann took pen and paper to reply to [his]211-the professor letter , [her]51-miss ann heart felt very warm toward [[her]51-miss ann old friend]881-her old friend . " [[MY]51-miss ann DEAR]1892-my dear PROFESSOR "[51-miss ann] [she]51-miss ann wrote , " [I]51-miss ann rejoice to hear of [your]211-the professor good fortune . [She]48-christobel rang the bell , and sent the answer to [the Professor]211-the professor 's letter , by [Jenkins]60-jenkins . [She]48-christobel could not wait for the slow medium of the post . [She]48-christobel stood at the breakfast - room window , and watched [Jenkins]60-jenkins as [he]129-the boy hurried down [the garden]201-the garden with the note . Until then , life was somewhat intolerable .

The proud blood mantled again over the face , the strong sweet beauty of which [the Boy]129-the boy so loved . [Her]48-christobel letter to [the Professor]211-the professor had not been easy to write . [She]48-christobel had had to be true to [herself]48-christobel , and true to [him]129-the boy , in the light of what [she]48-christobel knew to be [his]129-the boy real feeling in the matter ; bearing in mind that before long [he]129-the boy would almost certainly learn from [Miss Ann]51-miss ann that [she]48-christobel had replied to [his]129-the boy proposal after having read [his]129-the boy sentiments on the subject , so candidly expressed on the first page of [his]129-the boy letter to [[his]129-the boy sister]1744-his sister .

To relieve [her]48-christobel mind , after this intricate whirl of cross - correspondence , [she]48-christobel took up the Daily Graphic , and opened it , casually turning the pages .

Suddenly there looked out at [her]48-christobel from the central page , the merry , handsome , daring face of [her]48-christobel own Little Boy Blue . [He]129-the boy was seated in [his]129-the boy flying - machine steering - wheel in hand , looking out from among many wires . [His]129-the boy cap was on the back of [his]129-the boy head , [his]129-the boy bright eyes looked straight into [hers]48-christobel ; [his]129-the boy firm young lips , parted in a smile , seemed to say ; " [I]129-the boy jolly well mean to do it ! "[129-the boy] It was the very picture [she]48-christobel had seen in [the Professor]211-the professor 's Daily Mirror , in [her]48-christobel dream of the night before . Below was an account of the flight from [Folkestone]13-folkestone which [he]129-the boy was about to attempt .

Then [she]48-christobel remembered , with a shock of realization , that the flight across [the Channel]1014-the channel , round [Boulogne Cathedral]43-boulogne cathedral and back , was to take place on that very day . [His]129-the boy telegram , of the night before , had said : " [I]129-the boy am going to do a big fly to - morrow . Wish [me]129-the boy luck . "[129-the boy] Ah , what if it ended as [she]48-christobel had seen it end in [her]48-christobel dream : great broken wings ; a mass of tangled wire ; and the Boy [her]48-christobel Boy with matted hair , and wounded head , asleep beneath the sailcloth !

[Her]48-christobel heart stood still .

With [their]1203-their perfect joy so near its fulfilment , [she]48-christobel could not let [him]129-the boy take the risk . Was there time to stop [him]129-the boy ?

[She]48-christobel looked at the paper . The start was for 2 p.m. It was now eleven o'clock .

[She]48-christobel remembered [his]129-the boy last words : " When [you]2071-you want [me]129-the boy and send why , [I]129-the boy will come from [the other end of [the world]1427-the world]1440-the other end of the world . "[129-the boy]

[She]48-christobel never quite knew how [she]48-christobel reached [the telegraph - office]1204-the telegraph - office . It seemed almost as dreamlike as [her]48-christobel flight from the top to [the bottom of [the Folkestone cliffs]1206-the folkestone cliffs]1205-the bottom of the folkestone cliffs . But it was not a dream this time ; it was desperate reality .

Why do [people]689-people always break the points of the pencils hanging from strings in [the telegraph - offices]1208-the telegraph - offices ? Surely it is possible to write a telegram without stubbing off the pencil , and leaving it in that condition , for [the next person in a hurry]1209-the next person in a hurry .

[She]48-christobel flew from [compartment]1210-compartment to [compartment]1210-compartment , and at last produced [her]48-christobel own pencil , and wrote [her]48-christobel telegram in the final section of the row , independent of official broken points .

" Do not fly to - day . Come to [me]48-christobel . [I]48-christobel want [you]1213-you .[48-christobel]

" [Christobel]48-christobel . "[48-christobel]

"[48-christobel] [She]48-christobel had no idea what to call [the places]1214-the places , but this sounded well , and seemed an intuition , or an unconscious recollection of some remark of [the Boy]129-the boy 's .

[She]48-christobel handed it over the counter . " Please see that it goes through at once , "[48-christobel] [she]48-christobel said .

[The clerk]1216-the clerk knew [her]48-christobel . " Yes , [Miss Charteris]48-christobel , "[1216-the clerk] [he]1216-the clerk replied . " It should be there before noon , [Miss Charteris]48-christobel , "[1216-the clerk] [he]1216-the clerk said .

[He]1216-the clerk did not look at [her]48-christobel , as [he]1216-the clerk passed [her]48-christobel the stamps . [He]1216-the clerk had long thought [her]48-christobel one of [the finest women who stepped in and out of [the post - office]1218-the post - office]1217-the finest women who stepped in and out of the post - office . [He]1216-the clerk had never expected to see [her]48-christobel hands tremble . And fancy any woman even [she]48-christobel being able to tell [Guy Chelsea]50-guy chelsea not to fly ! [He]1216-the clerk had a bet on , about that flight , with an enthusiastic backer of [Chelsea]50-guy chelsea 's . [He]1216-the clerk was glad [he]1216-the clerk had taken the odds against its coming off , before seeing this wire . But after all ! It is easy enough to ask [a chap]1219-a chap not to fly ; but

[He]1216-the clerk took up a copy of the Daily Mirror , and looked at [the brave smiling face]1220-the brave smiling face . " [I]1221-the young aeronaut jolly well mean to do it ! "[1221-the young aeronaut] [the young aeronaut]1221-the young aeronaut seemed to be saying . [The clerk]1216-the clerk laughed , and shook [his]1216-the clerk head . " Hurry up that wire , "[1216-the clerk] [he]1216-the clerk called to [the operator]1223-the operator . Then [he]1216-the clerk jingled the loose change in [his]1216-the clerk pockets . " [I]1216-the clerk wonder , "[1216-the clerk] [he]1216-the clerk said .

During the hours which followed , [Christobel Charteris]48-christobel knew suspense .

Perhaps that strong , self - contained nature could never have fully sounded the depths of its own surrender , without those hours of uncertainty , when nothing stood between [her]48-christobel and [the man [she]48-christobel loved]659-the man she loved , but the possibility that [her]48-christobel telegram would fail to reach [him]1216-the clerk ; that [he]1216-the clerk would carry out [his]1216-the clerk dangerous flight ; that disaster and death would overtake [him]1216-the clerk and wrest [him]1216-the clerk from [her]48-christobel , and that [he]1216-the clerk would die [Guy Chelsea]50-guy chelsea would die without ever knowing of the cup of bliss [she]48-christobel was now ready , with utterly loving hand , to hold to [his]1216-the clerk lips .

Having sent [her]48-christobel message , there was nothing more [she]48-christobel could do , and the burden of inaction seemed almost too great a weight to carry , during the hours which must elapse , before [his]1216-the clerk coming could turn uncertainty into assurance ; restlessness , into peace .

It did not occur to [her]48-christobel , as a possibility , that [Guy Chelsea]50-guy chelsea would elect to fly , after receiving [her]48-christobel request . [She]48-christobel knew [her]48-christobel slightest wish would be law to [the Boy]129-the boy 's tender loyalty ; and though [he]1216-the clerk knew nothing of [her]48-christobel cause for anxiety , nor of the complete change of circumstances since [he]1216-the clerk left [her]48-christobel , not forty - eight hours before , [she]48-christobel felt sure [he]1216-the clerk would not fly ; [she]48-christobel felt certain [he]1216-the clerk would come if if the message reached [him]1216-the clerk in time .

At two o'clock it came to [her]48-christobel , with overwhelming certainty , that [her]48-christobel message had not reached [him]1216-the clerk , and that [he]1216-the clerk had started on [his]1216-the clerk flight . [She]48-christobel seemed to see the great wings mounting mounting ; then skimming over [the sea]1327-the sea . [She]48-christobel almost heard the hum [he]1216-the clerk had so often described the hum of the giant insect on which [the bird - man]369-the bird - man flew .

[Her]48-christobel own [Little Boy Blue]52-little boy blue was flying through space . O God , what might not any minute be bringing ! [He]1216-the clerk had said : " [One]1374-one never expects those things to happen , and when they do happen , it 's over so quickly that there is no time for expectation . "[1216-the clerk] Was it happening now ? Was it going to be over so quickly , that [her]48-christobel cup of bliss would be dashed from [her]48-christobel lips untasted ? [She]48-christobel was walking up and down [the garden]201-the garden now , and paused beside the chair in which [she]48-christobel had sat when [he]1216-the clerk had said , only seven days ago : " It was always [you]48-christobel [I]48-christobel wanted ; not [[your]48-christobel niece]1246-your niece . [She]48-christobel walked on slowly , moving to the repetition of those words . It seemed a comfort to repeat the great fact that , at last , [he]1216-the clerk was this to [her]48-christobel . The afternoon sun began to glint through the trees .

The jolly little " what - d'-you - call-'ems "[48-christobel] lifted pale anxious faces to the sky .

Clocks all around chimed the hour of four .

Suddenly [her]48-christobel limbs weakened . [She]48-christobel could walk no longer .

[She]48-christobel sank into a chair , beneath the mulberry - tree .

In a few minutes [Jenkins]60-jenkins would bring out tea . Would [Martha]56-martha have arranged a tea such as [the Boy]129-the boy loved , with cups for two , hot buttered - toast and explosive buns ?

What [a boy]1795-a boy [he]1216-the clerk was , at heart [this man who had won [her]48-christobel]1231-this man who had won her ; what [a gay , laughter - loving boy]1232-a gay , laughter - loving boy !

[She]48-christobel lay back , very still , under the mulberry - tree , and lived again through each of [the Boy]129-the boy 's days , from the first to the sixth .

[She]48-christobel kept [her]48-christobel eyes closed . The sunlight , glinting through the mulberry leaves , fell in bright patches on [her]48-christobel white gown , and on [her]48-christobel soft golden hair .

[The garden]201-the garden was very still . All nature seemed waiting with the heart that waited .

This was the seventh day .

[She]48-christobel rose , [her]48-christobel hands clasped upon [her]48-christobel breast , and stood waiting

Then the gate swung open and [the Boy]129-the boy came in , slamming it behind [him]129-the boy . [She]48-christobel saw [him]129-the boy coming up [the lawn]177-the lawn toward [her]48-christobel , bareheaded ; the sunlight in [his]129-the boy shining eyes .

"[48-christobel]

[He]1241-he bent over [her]1242-her .
